column9: Great promise but feels like a Google Product
column10:
Google is notorious for not fully developing their apps.

Freeform is the same.

The MacOS navigation experience is a disaster. Why Apple?

I first thought that using Freeform to organize project ideas and collect data would be a great idea between iPhone and Mac 

But I went back to use Notes and Miro app.

I also noticed how inconsistent Freeform is with capturing/saving shared data like website URLs images etc.

And at times even loosing those.

Not really a good application to be honest to compete.

Fine for doodling but not more.

I work as a designer and teach university level and thus expect a product to do at least the basics.
Best app in the world

column9: There should be folders for boards
column10: I use freeform for taking notes in maths class and it’s very helpful, but it would be great if there was a way to organize boards into specific folders. I have 20+ boards for different math concepts in different subjects (trigonometry, algebra, calculus) for different tests and it would be very nice to have been able to organize my boards for each subject rather than just have it all by recents.
Poopy
It is a very nice app! It's easy to study and easy to work with this stuff.

Since Notability basically disabled their art functions in 2023, I have been using and enjoying Freeform. A couple of issues, though, and one problem. I do some cartooning, and would like to see a “thought cloud” included in the Shapes tool. A parallelogram and trapezoid would also be useful, or the ability to modify the rectangle. It would also be useful to have “hollow” shapes (ie, outlines that would show against the whit background). PROBLEM: From time to time the program simply stops working. It closes down and essentially shuts down the phone. At first this was sporadic and didn’t even rise to the level of annoyance, but it is happening more and more often. I have deleted and reinstalled the app; hoping this will have some effect.

It’s less than a month since I wrote the review above.  I have severely reduced the number of boards I use, and the volume of content—and the problem is becoming well nigh intolerable.  I’ve reduced my rating from 4 stars to 3, and by the time it reaches 2 I will be gone. I seriously CAN live without a drawing app.

column9: Has critical bugs - Would be Favorite.
column10: This app has well-known issues and apple hasn’t fixed it. Multiple times now, this app has ruined the handwriting from my Apple Pencil after I close the app and return to the project at a later date. It’s really frustrating to have this happen when I’ve invested hours into getting ideas out and written down. I’ve reached out to apple support and they weren’t able to solve the issue, suggested that it might be an iCloud syncing error, which when I turned off syncing, it deleted all of my projects - this was heartbreaking and pretty much sent me spiraling.

Hope to see these features added!

Also, we can create a project spread and then work on it for an hour or so but then when we try return to it later or the next day, we end having completely different versions of the same project because of save/sync anomalies. Can’t believe Apple still churn out so many half baked products, they’re becoming like Google

column9: Great!… but there are two easy-fix issues needed to be solved
column10: Since this app launched, I’ve been using it daily, I’m a very visual based person when it comes to note taking, organising and productivity. I use this as a way to keep all my info, research, structure work plans, literally everything. And I’ve finally felt compelled to write a review because of two basic things that should be implemented by now… One being FOLDERS!!! If you’re like me using this frequent. Its become super cluttered and I can’t organise it outside of ‘Favorites’, and thats not enough. Apple Notes, Reminders even Voice Memo have folders, why doesn't Freeform???… And also, when uploading images/videos together, they seem to be grouped together overlapping each other. Why is there no way to align them from the moment they are uploaded without them overlapping?… Two simple additions/changes that would be massively useful. Please make these amendments in a near future update please!

The idea of a murder mystery has always struck me as brill, so when i heard the news of a murder i jumped, no flew out of my chair and onto a seat at the local police station. There are 10 suspects and it is my job to figure out who did it. My first suspect was named [redacted due to privacy violations]. I asked them “what was your goal when you went to the area where the murder happened?” And they responded “i can’t remember. It was a blur but there is one thing i can tell you, i didn’t do it.” The next thing i asked was they’re profession. “Well, i was a major part in a football team (too all you Americans it is called soccer) and then i sold firearms at a school.” The last one struck me as odd but they must’ve said the wrong thing however I will add that to my notes.

column9: So close to perfect for the Apple Pencil!
column10: I love all the tools available, all the ways it can be used for sure, all it needs to be perfect… I think would be some extra tools for the Apple Pencil itself, like… I’d suggest a brush being one of the effects for the Apple Pencil, because it would be wonderful to make more traditional paint-brush-effects, for recreating traditional paintings digitally. I also would suggest a pallet knife effect too, as this would also have a fantastic effect as well. Honestly, got greatly recently inspired by watching Bob Ross and his fantastic work, I especially believe his methods could be recreated digitally if the tools can be recreated, like the tools he’s used in painting itself. Trust me Apple, you guys would want to invest in these upgrades to the software, especially with how the 1st gen and 2nd gen Apple Pencil investments are for the artists above all else. I’d suggest this, due to how especially with the 2nd gen version of the Pencil has extra buttons too, people could program the buttons for switching between brush sizes and shapes, as well as how strong or light the brush can work. Genuinely, I wanna use my Apple Pencil for art more, since Bob Ross has me wanting to try pseudo painting, and this software updating for more tools would make every possible artist so happy it isn’t even funny!

column9: Sometimes the little things just ruin it
column10:
As generally interesting as this app looks, for my particular use case it's utterly useless - but shouldn't be. I'm trying to create simple graphics using foreign footballer names entered by text. As these names are foreign (to my English keyboard) the names are underlined in red and there's absolutely no way to get rid of this.

I have the spelling options off in Settings in the first place so I do not know why it is even flagging them. I cannot add them to a custom disctionary and internet searches throw up multiple suggestions, none of which work.

With the last graphic I did I had to use a retouch tool and painstakingly remove all the red underlines causing me to think to myself just how ridiculous this is. I'm not wasting anymore time trying to do what should be the simplest of tasks here.

column9: Do not under any circumstances start a real project in this app.
column10: Bugs I've encountered in 2 days of using for uni: - if you zoom in, it's going to be laggy. literally unusable laggy. 1 fps best case laggy. - drawings do not auto-complete, circles/rectangles have to be added manually - manually added objects have the WORST handling. If you try to select one, you'll propably select the wrong one because of bad programming. It's not your chubby fingers, its the app. - this app is infuriatingly laggy. ALL. THE. TIME. - if you try to encircle/backgroundcolor a drawing, simply don't. Often it won't work and draw over your drawing. Genuis programming. - Moving stuff often simply dosent work, especially with rectangles nearby. - Try selecting your drawings incl. the text/rectangles? No! Because f you, thats why. - when duplicating, the colored marks and drawings will often end up in differend places. Also expect the duplicate to not be selected to move. Instead the original will be selected. This will often bring you to a 3min cleanup session, where you remove the displaced duplicate, because: - 50% of times the undo-button dosen't work. I want to love this app, but there are way too many frustrations while doing fairly simple mock-ups.
- The grid axis is to uniformed.  Folks use grids to draw in equal increments, so drawing 58” was a real pain.  Simple solution: have every 5 or 10 axis lines be a little darker.
- The ruler increments are relative to nothing.  Because of the problem stated above, I used the ruler to do some measuring, but the moment I zoomed even a little bit, it was incorrect because the ruler’s markings do not change with the zoom.  The markings are just decorative?  This not only unhelpful, but is actually misleading because most folks eyes are drawn to markings on a ruler as guiding points for precision.
- The lasso does not seem to detect what I am trying to select, and when I finally get the right items selected, I cannot find a way to group them together.  My pencil is allowed to lasso, but then when I go to move it automatically switches back to pencil.  I might be able to change this in the settings, but the default behavior is unintuitive to the point of frustration.
I want to be as unbiased as possible, I wasn’t sure if perhaps I was being impatient and just had to learn how to use the system, but I tried out Excalidraw, a web app, and was able to accomplish 30 seconds what took me 15 minutes in this app.  (Bonus, the grid auto snaps lines to the axis, a UI concept that seems like it would be obvious)
This app feels rushed and untested.  It looks very nice, and then has very poor functionality.

The tools are not better - the lasso groups items together even if they are not selected, making the moving of specific bits of text/writing difficult. The app doesn’t remember your settings (eg pen size/colour). The selection of tools is pretty nice though. 
Zooming is incredibly buggy at any given time.

The freeform isn't actually free. It's extremely hard to work with this app, because no matter how hard I tried, I couldn't find a way to change a position of a handwritten block. Why don't you have a lasso? This function exist literally everywhere else.  Why, in case to change a position of a written block, I have to erase and rewrite the whole block? It just doesn't make sense. The idea is actually awesome. But it's impossible to work with such a huge canvas without the ability to change the placement of everything. Because in the beginning of a project I just can’t know where this one particular idea will go. Especially if the project is really big.

column9: A Pragmatists Ideal with Great Potential
column10:
I really hope this project isn’t abandoned. It’s stripped down design and simplicity were a major draw and I hope that doesn’t change. I use it almost daily, exclusively, and insofar as it comes to usability and navigation; the interface/interaction flow… it’s unparalleled. 
The issues so far are performance related especially as the “notes” themselves get longer or more intricate. Lags and crashes become more frequent and the export feature has quirks; specifically if a note is renamed and exported as a pdf the export quality is noticeably lower- coupled with some minor quality of life fixes and performance enhancements Freeform could definitely turn into a reliable mainstay. I recommend it to all!

column9: It is a document manager - without any subfolders, so no organization
column10:
This app is missing the ability to have subfolders to organize notes. All your notes are piled together in one place separated only by title, so you can’t separate them by subject or any other way. Therefore, there is no file organization, which means it is not usable from that alone. Any document manager with files needs the ability to have subfolders and folders at all, so we really need that before any other features roll out. All file managers need subfolders.

A bit of programmer talk below for the developers:
Also, there doesn’t seem to be a property list element that stores the settings for the pencil and eraser, so I have to click on the eraser and change how it erases each time I open the app. The user also cannot let the pencil menu store different colors and textures other than the default ones, which means that you have to tap or click many times to get to different colors. It seems like there needs to be an updated pencil palate object or otherwise to store these features in the app in a property list and therefore allow better utilization of electronic note taking. We need to break out of the physical boundaries of note-taking with paper to allow the iPad to have note taking do what it can do. Hope I was not too critical, but these features are truly necessary to make this app worth its presence. Otherwise, you cannot edit effectively without wasting time clicking many times. And without subfolders, organization is impossible without replacing the names of the notes with directory-style names, which is not practical. I have not experienced any errors, just lacking necessary features for a file manager and annotation software.

column9: Freeform helps me put everything together and share it with everyone
column10:
I manage all sorts of projects and planning with Freeform. From Girl Scout badge planning, year planning, and level planning, holiday get together and meals, semester classes and long term education planning, genealogy research, and vacation planning all ends up in a Freeform board. 

The expandable canvas allows me to put everything together, and share it with the right people, so we can accomplish that board’s particular goat. Making it easy to collect information in whatever form it’s in while collaborating with the right people make Freeform a tremendous support for getting things done right.

Excellent product, couple of things to think about when you make a main amendment to a document in pages. It would be good if when entering from Freeform that document changed rather than having to re-connect.

column9: 40+ years as Apple customer, about to leave Apple for good
column10:
Don’t trust important stuff with this app!! This is possibly the last straw Apple!

I’ve been using this App since April and it’s been amazing at keeping me organized, until NOW

For some reason, the app will crash every few minutes. Sometimes I’m just staring at the screen and poof! The app crashes. I CANT WORK LIKE THIS! 

I’ve been noticing the app running slow and jittery which made me wonder if it’s a memory issue, kinda like the files are too big to handle. This is NOT a good Apple user experience! I’m on an iPad Pro that’s not even a year old. I have power-restarted (volume up/down, hold power button) as well as deleting the app and re-downloading.

Over the years Apple products and software are increasingly becoming problematic. I don’t know what has changed at Apple over the last  8 years or so, but you’re about to lose a lifetime customer over poor user experiences and your stuff JUST NOT working like it once did.

I have so many Apple products and find myself screaming at Apple on a daily basis, I’m SICK OF IT! If my Apple experiences continue like this, I will drop Apple and NEVER come back. I’m brand loyal, until that brand shows me it doesn’t care and frankly, Apple isn’t convincing me it cares at all!

My partner was trying to find a way to export a board as an image file. She tapped the share button, after which she was prompted to turn on iCloud sync for Free Form in settings. She did this, returned to Free Form and re-tapped the share button. There was no option to export her board as an image so she returned to settings to turn iCloud sync off for Free Form. 

NOTE: iCloud sync for Free Form was never turned ON to begin with, so her existing boards should not have been stored there, rather, on her device storage. So turning iCloud sync back off should not have deleted the original board files. Instead, turning iCloud sync off, wiped all of her boards completely - no trace of them, no recently deleted files, nothing!

What’s more, the warning given as she turned iCloud back off said “recent UPDATES” to boards would be deleted if iCloud sync was turned off for free form, not the entire board and any evidence it even existed!

Moral of the story, use free form as a doodling tool at most, not for anything you care about and don’t want to lose.

column9: Not ready for prime time. Sausage stylus
column10:
**Update 11/2023 added a star for the long awaited addition of pressure sensitivity. Still need to test stability to see if there are improvements from my last review. 

In summary, it’s not ready for prime time. I would not use this for any real work. I’m including my experience with both iPadOS and later with macOS. Now onto the details. First, no pressure sensitivity? Might as well use a sausage instead of my $100+ Apple Pencil. Next, I lost about a couple of hours of work. I went from using my iPad Pro and moved over to Freeform on my MacBookPro and bam, the board loaded only half of the content. I went back to my iPad Pro and watched as the content disappeared before my eyes. For the macOS version, there’s no pen/drawing tools. I’m pretty sure I’m not the only one that would like to use my pen tablet to take notes and draw on my Mac. And not only that, people still like to use their mouse to draw quick things (like arrows or circle something). I just don’t get it, it’s on the iPad but they turned it off for Mac, seems like more work for them not to include basic drawing functionality. Finally, it’s 2022, and still no 2 finger tap = undo, no 3 finger redo? Panning and zooming is terrible on the mac. Usually on desktop, shortcuts like holding down the space bar will allow you to pan, but not in Freeform, you have to grab tiny scrollbars and manually drag to navigate the board. Implement what every other design tool does: Space to pan, Hold Cmd and zoom wheel to zoom in/out. I’m just really disappointed in how bad this is, I was really looking forward to it.

“Can you please, please release an update for this app because if you have updated this app recently, it has done nothing but made my experience worse than ever.

column9: Link to Apple Notes is missing
column10:
Sure, you can easily link to Apple Pages, but i don’t start writing in a publishing app. First I collect info, draft, etc… in Notes. 

You can’t easily link to an Apple Note. There is a convoluted way where you go into an note, share it “with yourself” which only then gives you the option to copy the note link that you can paste into Freeform. Otherwise you’re only copying the contents. 

This one feature keeps me from using both apps as it is too much friction to integrate them together. I’m trying to use Obsidian with its Excalidraw and Canvas plugins, but that is only easier by a hair.

column9: There is no organizational what so ever, and a few other issues…
column10:
Freeform is fantastic for the most part. My notes tend to include tons of pictures, scans, PDFs and handwriting and id switch to Freeform in a heartbeat except for one massive issue. There is absolutely no way to organize anything!! How on earth was that not considered? Theres no folder’s, no groups, no subjects, no tags, nothing except it sorts by date and you can favorite things…massive shortcoming that literally makes it unusable for anything serious. 

Only other issue I have is that I do enjoy the fact that I can draw on top of videos. However when you go to play the video the drawing shows a opaque white background blocking most of the video…

I don’t understand what’s going on with Apple and pushing iCloud so much recently. Or maybe it’s not recent, I don’t know. All I know is it’s now two recently updated Apple applications that I cannot fully use it use at all without having iCloud turned on. First it was the Apple Support app that once I updated it informed me that I could not use the application at all if I didn’t have iCloud turned. What the heck?! Why?! Now, with this really awesome, Freeform, program, I’m able to use most of the app but if I want to export and save a project to my Photo Library. Well, you guessed it! I have to have iCloud turned on. Why?!  I have an older version of Freeform on my iPad. And it allows me to fully use the program without having iCloud turned on. What does Apple’s cloud storage have to do with me being able to save my Freeform projects to my Photo Library now???  I just don’t get it. Is this just a reinvigorated push to try and get all Apple users to pay for more iCloud storage? It does not make a lick of sense that I cannot use the Support application at all with iCloud and now I cannot save projects in Freeform without it turned on. Both of those restrictions are anti-consumer in my opinion and I guess I’ll just look for alternatives to use instead of using these Apple owned programs. Very frustrating to see this happening. I just want to get support and save my projects. What do either of those things have to with Apple Cloud Storage???? It’s ridiculous!

column9: Very good app, desperately needs 1 fix and 1 feature
column10:
For the most part and especially with snap to object features being added, this app is amazing. However, it requires at least one more feature present in other Apple apps that use Pencil:

Tool memory: This is not present in the latest release as of oct 2023, and is the apps ability to remember the settings of the tools as last used. For example, I prefer the use of the object eraser over the pixel eraser, the latter of which is the default that the tool is reset to every time I leave the app or start a new board. 

Secondly, this app is in desperate need of an organizational system from within the app. Some sort of file folder system would be most useful, so that boards can be organized appropriately and I am not faced with a random array of every board I have ever made every time I open the app.

With these fixes alone the app would be near perfect

I just used Freeform to take notes at a conference. I knew going into it that it’s not really made for note taking. The experience was just OK. I made a sticky note for each session, and was frustrated by some things. The sticky notes could only be square, which posed some problems when trying to organize them on the board. Also, it would be really helpful to be able to write on sticky notes with Apple pencil. I couldn’t find a way to group items, either. A few font choices would be nice; just a few, like one serif and one simple script, as I realize part of the appeal is to keep things simple.

I will, however use Freeform again for days two and three. Maybe I’ll like it better after I use it more. I don’t really want to learn yet another app, and Notes has its limitations as well. At least with sticky notes it’s easier to move information around. I can zoom out to see it all at once, too, if I choose.
I’m not sure what advice to give you guys but it could be better. But it’s still pretty cool! :)

column9: Would like options for folders or digital notebook
column10: I love this app and have used it a lot for school.it has been especially helpful for my major in nursing. One thing though would be that when the page would get too full, the app would crash. Luckily the work would always save and be there when I had to reopen it but it happened a lot, especially when my one page summary sheets would get pretty in depth and cover a lot of area. If Freeform could have folders that would organize your different boards, that would be amazing. Another cool feature Apple could do in general and keep in Freeform would be to make a notebook style layout with templates for grids, dots, lined paper etc. If organizing the boards into folders couldn’t be done, the capacity to make a notebook with pages you can flip through and have all the same features as Freeform has with the drawing, shapes, colors, and tool options that would be amazing. I love the thought of having a digital notebook I can flip through that can incorporate photos, design elements, and my handwritten or the option of typed captions.
Good for bigger drawers

column9: Please read this before downloading the app
column10: If you have a time limit, this may not work. However, there are still other things you can do about this. If you have a time limit it might not let you draw using the marker icon or crayon icon. You can still spawn shapes, and upload pics onto the workspace, but you might not be able to draw. Please take this to mind if you have a time limit. If not, this is a very good app to use for creative drawing, writing, and presenting with. Thank you for understanding this warning. column9: Not syncing, no files to share
column10:
It does not sync with all devices. Sometimes rebooting solves it.

You don't have the file (it only exists inside the app). Which means you cannot zip and share with other kinds of files.

Even if you want to share a JPEG or PDF you cannot because it keeps saying "wait to sync with icloud", the only thing you can do is to take a screenshot.

Great missed opportunity with this app.

Congratulation to everyone involved in this matter.

The crayon was my favorite writing tool in Freeform. With the new update for iPad OS 17, it’s no longer the same. I’m willing to downgrade back to 16 to get the feature back. All the other updates are okay.

You can’t make folders, this makes it ridiculously impractical for anyone other than your two year old. 

Imagine this is the line you just typed. 
And when you press return it switches to bold, underlined, and 24 pt font every new line you enter, no matter how many times you change it back. PAINFUL. You can’t save text styles either.

No instructions on how to use it.

What is it for ?

It’s been added to my iPhone and I did not add it in ?

it’s a good app, great for writing notes, reminders, drawings. The only thing is that whenever I AM drawing, and I need to click undo, a lot of the times, it gets OUT of the whole drawing. So then I can’t just undo it, I have to erase it. Which is kind of difficult if you ask me. But I only really draw on there. Sometimes I take notes, and it gets messed up kind of easily. Or when I’m putting pictures, it doesn’t let me control the size a lot, and it gets hard, it either flips, gets too big, too small, or goes upside down. Which is annoying. 

It’s a nice app, but it could use some adjustments. Like not putting the undo button RIGHT NEXT to the exit button. Or just when you click the exit button, it asks you if you are sure you want to leave. That would make it easier. 
Overall it’s pretty good. And I like to use it, just sometimes gets on my nerves.

column9: After iPadOS 17 update, text box selection with cursor rarely works
column10:
Despite the several improvements made in other areas of the app after iPadOS 17 update, the text box content selection with cursor (either using fingers or the pen) rarely works. I have to double click and “select all” through the pop-up menu, but not by dragging the selection tool.

I am having to resort to editing text content in other apps, and just pasting it in the Freeform text box for now. This is quite counterproductive, even in collaboration projects.

Please look into this, dev team!

column9: The Moodboarder’s Dream App with Some Hiccups
column10:
Freeform is the app I’ve been waiting for. However, I don’t use it the way it’s intended—I don’t collaborate. For me, it’s my go-to moodboarding app. I love capturing ideas and inspirations in a non-linear way. I can place pictures, screenshots, video clips, drawings right next to short text notes or handwritten comments. While the Notes app can do some of that, they quickly turn my notes into long, almost non-searchable pages. Freeform lets me arrange all these elements any way I want.

But, there’s a downside: the app isn’t very stable. I often encounter issues, especially with boards that have more content. Recently, I realized that I constantly worry about the possibility of losing a board due to errors.

Working with text is a bit tricky. I’d appreciate more user-friendly ways to add titles. Sections would be a great addition, and a tag system would be a welcome feature. The ability to link mood boards together would also be fantastic. And seriously, why isn’t Freeform in the OS sharing menu?

It’s great for making pdf documents when it wants to work, i’ll explain later in the review, and i use this with a shortcut to convert it to a PNG so i can use it as a shortcut logo when adding a shortcut to the home screen, and i also just use it for artistic purposes as well. However, most of the time, when resizing a shape, it lags the whole phone, and turns what was supposed to be a slightly larger shape into a very stretched shape up to 10000+ pixels wide/tall. I can’t interact with the phone while this is happening, the home button(yes my phone isn’t one of the newer ones without a home button, i believe it’s an iPhone 8 Plus or something) and power button does nothing. Tried force shutdown by holding the button, no result. Maybe i didn’t hold it for long enough. Maybe it’s just the phone, and, if so, i would rate it 5 stars if i knew if that was the case. I am using the latest version of iOS at the time of the making of this review.

column9: Great Concept, but unoptimised and missing Tools
column10: Freeform is a great app for sketching and as a digital Notebook, but it (sadly) won’t replace any proper note taking apps YET. It’s missing crucial tools such as a ruler or circle tool, and the app runs poorly when having written more than A4-paper size. Pen inputs get super laggy and the app misses some short strokes completely - the more you write the worse it gets. I hope Apple take their time to optimise the app for people who want to use it as a proper digital notebook.
It’s a good app that offers a near hand to paper experience for Apple users. It’s good to use this app because the plague of ads has not caught on. Hope it stays that way.

Great if you need to jot down a recipe, some notes, or if you want to brainstorm. The boards are all infinite canvases, so everything won’t feel crammed. I think it hit it’s target audience fairly well. The interface is awesome on iPad, but with the tiny screen of a phone, it’s way easier to just use the Notes app to type out your notes instead of handwriting them. (There’s a text tool but it’s easier to handwrite in my opinion) I love visualizing my thoughts so I’m definitely going to use this for personal things. I don’t see myself using it for anything more than personal projects. As for the collab feature, it’s a bit wonky, and I’m still trying to figure out how “in real time” it really is. Because this is semi-new, I don’t expect it to be wondrous in every way. With that said I hope it improves on itself in the future.

EDIT: here are some commonly agreed on suggestions to make it better/more efficient: double tap to undo/triple tap to redo, further zoom etc. And, I don’t know if anyone else said this, but I’d love a dark mode. Not just for the main screen, but for the boards as well. Would definitely be easier on your eyes.

column9: Good start - some improvements for flow charts please
column10: Very good start. Mobile design apps is a current gap, even for the most popular design tools out there. Love that when an idea strikes me, I can use my iPhone to capture it in this app. Creating a flowchart is not very intuitive. The points on a shape only allow you to expand/shrink a shape. They don’t allow you to snap an arrow from one shape to another. To connect shapes for flowcharts, you will need to select the joining line shape, but it won’t snap to the proper corner of a diamond shape (often used for decision logic). Then you must move  the line to snap it to a corner. Then you must choose the arrow and select which end to add the arrow.  A bit tedious but it works. Hopefully flowcharting gets some love, otherwise awesome app!

Obviously this app should not be used as an art app or anything, but as someone who loves to draw, I found it super helpful just to jot down thumbnails or ideas when they came to me. It’s very loose, so it’s great to quickly get a sense of colour and form down without having to get out your art equipment. It’s helpful to try out different compositions before you commit on the final artwork. Also, if you aren’t artistic, it’s great for organising things (a bit like notes). The only thing I would change is that when you are tying to resize something with the lasso tool, it doesn’t let me turn it or resize it, it only lets me move it :( as well as that, it’s really laggy if I use it for too long. Good start I guess.

column9: I want to love this app but…
column10:
As an artist, I compare this app to another called VizRef. 
I’ll list only my issues as that is what’s most productive. 

-Navigating around the canvas is a huge pain. You have to intentionally stop and consciously tap and pinch with two fingers to zoom out. Every other app that I use does not have such difficulty. 
- I would love it if there were an option to upload higher quality images by default, rather than having to do it for every single image. As an artist, having full resolution images is very important. Having this at the level of a board would be fantastic. 
-Options to flip, and freely rotate would be fantastic.and finally, an option to remove or temporarily disable grid constraints would be so helpful. 

I want to use this app more because the organization and collaboration components are very useful for me as an educator, but the previous issues keep it unviable.

This is a very interesting app, and from just starting about 2 weeks ago, I’ve learned a lot about creating things, from logos, small drafts, to making wonderful art. The creativity put into these things are really amazing and surprisingly easy to do, especially when you’re trying to make something important for yourself and/or your family, friends or any other social group you want to share with, as a developer, author, and editor.. This app comes in handy in all sorts of situations. Now I know what you’re trying to look for, tools! The tools in this app are really useful, shapes, paintbrushes, easy-to-use paints, smooth lines.. Textures, and you can (( PRETTY SURE )) use apple pen, which in my opinion.. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ For those who have barely started their careers in art or development, I’d consider this a great opportunity to start in THIS app, I highly encourage it and I would most certainly recommend it. Though I’m not sure ANY of this made sense, since I live in my own world.. If this did make sense to you though, I’m sure you could do great things with this app. If you’re looking to share your projects with others, you’ll need to connect it with iCloud or something else, since I’m an iOS user. It was sure a miracle to find this app on my homescreen, thanks for creating this app, I love it!!!

column9: Not the worst, but not the best
column10: So far out of the note taking apps I’ve tried, this one is one of my favorites. I really like the infinite amount of space within a single project and how fluid it is. Unfortunately, I can’t say I’m a fan of the lag. Even on projects that I’ve only written a couple things on, it starts to lag. Also, I hope a stabilization function can be added for the tools. My handwriting is pretty messy because of my shaky hands, so stabilization for the pens would just be neat. Also, folders to organize the projects would be cool. Other than that, no complaints!

I love this app! However, I do have a few suggestions for improvement. First, perhaps add a background option, so you can have different backgrounds. Second, maybe add a shape correction tool, so when you’re drawing freehand, there is an option to fix any mistakes. I understand this may not be possible for all images, but maybe some more common ones like animal parts and people parts, as well as slightly more complex objects, such as ice cream or a phone. Finally, how about an option to turn images into a short animation or slideshow? These could be some fun additions to an already great app.

column9: I really want to rate 5 stars, but not quite there yet.
column10: I really want to rate it five stars. And don’t get me wrong, there is a refreshing amount of flexibility in terms of design elements and how you want to structure the document, which I appreciate. However, if you’re going to introduce shapes, you should also have easily accessible manipulations like being able to flip them directionally. Additionally, and mainly the reason for rating 3 stars, is that the app appears to get buggy the larger the file you try to have. I have a doc with lots of writing (using 2nd gen Apple Pencil) lined up in columns and the app will frequently lag or crash when I’m trying to use it. If you want the app to be like a Freeform whiteboard, it’s got to be able to seamlessly perform like that no matter how much info you put in the doc.

I have lost so many notes to this app I can no longer use it. 

I’m a prolific note taker and have used a ton of apps like this with similar (and sometimes better) functionality. I would love very much to have the safety of an app that is supported within Apple’s ecosystem, but there is a persistent and egregious bug: the app “loses” pencil strokes with stunning regularity in such a way that you can take pages and pages of handwritten notes, save and exit, and then open the same document back up to find your writing half erased to the point of being unreadable. 

I’m so angry at this app at this point I would chuck it in a bin if it were a physical object.

column9: Needs work, could have been great!
column10:
My main gripe is that this app drains my iPad battery big time! 

Areas for improvement:
- It could do a better job with making use of the full extent of the Apple pencil’s features. Much of the pencil is left untapped.

- You can’t sort projects into folders. Notes does this and it is so helpful. How can I organize my projects when they all pile into the same place?

- Kills my battery. iPad Pro 11” (2022) dead within 4 hours.

- Needs more export options. An image file option would be nice!

Other than that it is flexible and very useful.

column9: Great APP to keep a daily journal
column10:
I’ve been using Freeform for a couple of weeks now, and I’m finding it very useful as a daily journal. I’m a family care-provider for my 97 year old grandfather. This APP allows me to basically, as the name implies, ‘Freeform’ my ideas, thoughts, conversations, photos…etc. I’m putting a storyboard together of my time with my grandfather. Eventually I’ll share with my family and friends the time and experience with him. Thanks Apple!

6/30/23. I’m still liking this app! I’ve been ‘doodling’ with continuity sketching and pasting that to a board. Also, I like the ability to copy from Freeform and paste directly to a Pages doc. And the ‘grid’ is perfect for my origami fold patterns. 
Cheers!

I just got the ipad M1 2022 and the 2nd generation Apple pencil for work purposes, especially for taking notes. I was really dissapointed to see that Freeform performs really badly after 30 minutes to 1 hour using it. It crashes a lot and the pencil starts lagging significantly. And yes, I have closed the application, restarted my ipad, kept it and the apps up to date and the issue has not been resolved.

And I have to say here I’m always been pleased with apple products, I currently have the M1 laptop and have had apple’s ipads and phones as long as I can remember. This is definitely not the quality I’m used to. Researched this a bit and definitely not the only one with these issues.

I LOVE having a portable/virtual whiteboard space that is built in to the apple environment. Features are great & mostly intuitnve.  However, there is room for improvement. There could be more options for the drawing tool (dotted line, auto-shape, better handwriting). These features are already available in Mac & iOS builds, so they'd be intuitive if brought over to FreeForm. It'd also be nice to have some better exporting tools (framing, cropping, file types, etc). 

Note: 
- For larger files there does seem to be significant lag time.

It can’t handle too much of content in a single sheet, you have to keep creating a new sheet every now and then, as the existing sheet will start jittering a lot, to the point that you won’t be able to write on it anymore. OneNote on the other hand can more content per sheet (it also has infinite canvas). 
Apple Notes is better than Freeform, as it doesn’t lag due to handling of large content per note.

I was trying to share a document and kept getting "Document has not synced yet, please wait before attempting to share." So I waited overnight and I still got the same message. Just sold 3 framed 16 x 20 pieces for $1200! Thanks so much! 😁

The concept of this app is pretty cool. You can collaborate with others and have a big canvas to work with. However, the concept is pretty bad. It’s rare to see my sketches show up on my friend’s devices, and if they do it takes eons for them to show up, or they only partially appear.

For instance, my friend and I have been trying constantly for the past two months to get a game of Hangman working. So far, I have guessed three letters. Only two of them have shown up. My friend wrote a letter down on her iPhone, I have yet to see it and it’s been a week.

Apple, please fix this. I would love to get to use this app for its intended purpose, but with this bug it’s virtually impossible to do so.

It’s good, for certain, and I like it a lot, but it has some real let-downs. If I have a project open, make changes or additions to it, and open it on, say, my Mac, the new changes will be a mess, not at all like how it is on my iPad, and that’s just how they are when viewed on that device. It crashes the most of any app I’ve ever used on my iPad (seriously, if Apple makes an app, I have come to expect a crash to be exceptionally rare, this happens fairly regularly). I don’t lose work when this happens, but, come on?

When I open it after not using it for a while, it will be a white screen for several moments before it loads, then I will have to redo Pencil settings, like line width and such. 

Bottom line? Looks like something Apple would make, with functionality you would more or less expect, but runs like something an understaffed startup would produce for their first app. Hope to see it improve soon, as, I do enjoy the app, despite the gripes I list here.

Sometimes I have a frustrating problem on my mind, business or personal. In any case this has been a life saver. I can use this to messily map out what’s in my mind and also create more artistic presentations. It’s simplistic yet catchy design is both innovative and nostolgic, from the helpful dots on the background to the shadows left by the sticky notes. You won’t often get a review from me like this, but after the fifth board I was hooked.
Possibly add a more artistic pen? It would give it just that final touch to make it more personal and eye catching.

I spend quite a bit of my time making and organizing lists and putting things into categories. I previously did this mostly within my photo albums, since it made it so that I didn’t have to copy paste, and could instead simply drag my images. While categorizing, though, the groups seemed to blend into one another, as there was no clear endpoint to anything. With this app, though, it functions basically as a bulletin board of sorts for me, but doesn’t require copious amounts of paper to use. It’s great!!
I do still have a few issues with this app, though I have learned to deal with them. For starters, it runs incredibly slowly. I don’t tend to put more than 40 images on a board, and yet applications such as adobe illustrator, which deal with many many more assets on average, seem to run twice as fast. Alongside this, typing is always a bit slow, and half of the time the app will not seem to register that I am even making an attempt to type.
Overall, though, despite my complaints, I am more than happy with this program, and I am extremely grateful that it even exists, let alone freely.

5/27/23 This app, created by Apple, is very useful because you can add notes, photos, and lots more. It’s easy to use and it doesn’t take much time to learn how to use it. Navigation is very easy too, not complicated at all. It’s great for a quick note or just to have a record of something. There are many uses, and you can learn what it’s all about from the free Apple Guides that you can download from the Apple Books Store. If reading is not your thing, you can find lots of tutorials on YouTube as well. I’m glad to have it, and I will be using it for as long as it’s around.

Although great for simple drawings and text, there are many features on the app, that should be updated. 
The application unfortunately does not work properly when sharing documents with others; the text keeps getting shuffled even across my own devices. The app is unstable and the undo button is located in a weird position, making it difficult to use. Considering practicality, it would be more suitable to have an undo feature that activates when two fingers touch the screen.
Furthermore, being able to have folders to organize documents would be helpful.
Adding empty figures to the collection would increase the variety and make it more appealing to use Freeform. 
An extra feature could be locking a drawing/text (done with apple pencil) onto the figure, so when changing the position, the content on the figure moves along with it.

column9: Freeform is great for brainstorming / note taking
column10:
Freeform is great for brainstorming / note taking. Handles pencil really well. Can paste many other objects into document. The page keeps expands as required.

The sharing between Apple devices and other iCloud users is also great.

The one major OMISSION is that non-iOS/MacOS users are shut out. It would be great if material could be shared dynamically on web pages (even if it is read only). Ultimately editing on web pages would be great.

Freeform is a captivating and entertaining television network that offers a diverse range of programming. With its unique blend of drama, comedy, and fantasy, Freeform has something for everyone. The network’s shows tackle various topics, from coming-of-age stories and supernatural adventures to social issues and LGBTQ+ representation.

One of the standout aspects of Freeform is its commitment to inclusivity and representation. The network has been at the forefront of showcasing diverse characters and storylines, allowing viewers from different backgrounds to see themselves on screen. This dedication to diversity is both refreshing and important, as it helps foster a more inclusive and accepting society.

Freeform’s original series have gained popularity for their relatable characters and engaging narratives. The network is known for delivering compelling storylines that keep viewers hooked, whether it’s through heartfelt dramas like “The Fosters” or supernatural hits like “Shadowhunters.” These shows often tackle relevant themes and offer thought-provoking commentary on societal issues, resonating with audiences of all ages.

In addition to its original programming, Freeform also airs popular acquired series and movies, providing a well-rounded entertainment experience. The network’s lineup includes a mix of classic favorites and contemporary hits, ensuring there’s always something to enjoy.

Furthermore, Freeform is active on social media, fostering a strong connection with its audience. The network engages with fans, shares behind-the-scenes content, and encourages meaningful conversations, creating a sense of community among its viewers.

Overall, Freeform stands out as a vibrant and inclusive network that delivers compelling content. Its commitment to diverse storytelling, relatable characters, and thought-provoking narratives makes it a worthwhile destination for television enthusiasts seeking engaging and inclusive entertainment.

I am a teacher at a small private school that cannot invest in electronic white boards. Freeboard is a flexible program that allows me to write freehand, type, create shapes, and copy/paste images and text. It has been an EXCELLENT white board for me, projected onto a whiteboard from my iPad. It allows me to easily present information in the form of diagrams and charts, and to record conversations across multiple days. Freeboard makes it easy to move, recolor, and otherwise edit elements on the board. It has replaced most other software I have been experimenting with.

This app is genius and I would easily rate it with 5 stars any day if it wasn’t because of one MAJOR issue it has (which has been reported several times in the past MONTHS): When you zoom in really close (+300%) to an object, panning around the screen or moving objects will become laggy. The closer you get beyond that point and the more objects you place on the whiteboard, the laggier it gets, to the point where the iPad reboots itself if you have too many objects on it. I have an iPad Pro with the M1 chip (5th Gen), but I’ve also seen the same behavior on the 6th gen with the more capable M2 chip. 

Please Apple, get your act together and fix this extremely annoying issue.

Apple integrations:
- interaction with apple reminders and calendar
- interaction with apple notes via cross link
- links from one board into another would be helpful (like Zettelkasten principle)

Organization:
- boards not organizable into folders or sections

In-Board functions:
- element link lines only clip at random position (should also be possible like in Microsoft Visio with fixed Ankers)
- Stack function (like Mindmaps where you can close a dedicated section) to close and open linked elements
- add text to link line (like in Visio)
- create PNG image with or without background of selected area (for creating high resolution images of the created and selected area instead of having to take a screenshot and post edit with external image editing tools)

First things first: an easy brainstorming app is a welcome addition. Freeform is in the early stages competing for the space currently dominated by Miro. From the whiteboarding side, would benefit from more options to connect objects. From the moodboard side, really need greater flexibility to manipulate objects: flip, remove backgrounds, custom trimming/masking, etc. Looking forward to see how Freeform matures. A hybrid of Miro, Xmind, and Polyvore (RIP) would check all the boxes for me.

Good app for a visual learner like me but it becomes so laggy after using it for a longer period. I hope apple can fix this asap.

I’m so disappointed by the functionality of it… everything is perfect except it’s so laggy and it heats my iPad up like it’s on fire.. 

For some context, I’m doing some renovations and I’m trying to use this board to gather some ideas.. 20 pictures in and it lags so horribly it keeps making the app quit.
I have lost years of my life’s work. You can’t backup the app to the cloud , and after an update to my iPad I completely lost everything. I’m unbelievably mad. This is unacceptable

Finally a note taking app with 4 directional complete freedom.

Enough tools to be a complete package for academic study.

It’s two pitfalls are:
lack of organization, so all notes are in the same space with no ability to split into subjects for study.
And the fact that every tile tries to always snap to some guidelines based on the other tiles, making it nearly (and sometimes actually) impossible to put a tile precisely where you want.

The endless space makes it great for mindmaps, but it’s missing some important features. It would be great to have the ability to make folders or even nest boards within other boards. A highlighter pen would also be helpful.
At first i didn’t know what it was but its pretty cool!
If you move or resize a line while fully zoomed in, the whole iPad starts to chug and stutter.
When i collaborate with someone or sync my iPhone and iPad i only have like a quarter of the drawings and the files don’t open at times

The app has sooo much potential.
I got really excited when I tried it out for the first time...
The sharing feature is glitchy and confusing, sharing the board is not the easiest thing (not even between Apple devices/ Apple IDs )
Tried every possible way with no luck. Had to opt out for copying the link and paste it in a shared note with my collaborator and even though the board would not update at all anything I added on the other participants/devices or the other way around. The information displayed is incomplete, missing drawings, text, data or any new input(only the original board will have it all); when I grabbed my phone and tried to open my own board created on the iPad there's the same problem, is missing information and all the new inputs.
I hope is an easy fix.
Cheers!
I think this app is great but IT WOULD BE EVEN BETTER 🤩🤩if a ruler was added so that we can draw straight lines and a function for us to highlight our words

column9: Unworthy of being called an Apple app.
column10: This app has so many bugs. Biggest is sync issues. I am using it on my ipad and iphone. Both running on latest ios. And when I write one page on ipad “on one go”. - mind it, i wrote entire page on one sitting on ipad and still only half of that page got synced in my iphone. Can anyone explain how on earth this is possible. If the entire page is not syned, i might think it is some temporary sync issue or something, but how can you sync half page and leave the other half.? Apple developers; are you listening. This is an extremely frustrating experience.
I’d love to switch to this but there are no folders, so I can’t organize anything.
Please fix the rotation. It won’t let you rotate more than half the time. Other than that one issue it is a really good quality app.

Or the possibility to add shape libraries yourself.
An app like this is finally here after years of waiting

column9: Loving it - just need a couple of crucial updates!

column9: DARK MODE??!!! STILL NOT AVAILABLE?? C’mon…
column10:
I tell people, when asked, to check this app out and the FIRST thing I get back after they load and use it is “No DARK MODE!” It isn’t like I am the ONLY person asking for this and giving the feedback you want to know about. Well, HOW MANY PEOPLE have to ask for DARK MODE after this length of time? I’ve started to use other Apps that DO have Dark Mode because it DOES make a difference and why do all the work here and then have to redo it elsewhere? 
If an App Developer isn’t going to listen to what the user needs and wants then I won’t support the developer. Simple. Not like there aren’t other choices out there. 
I PREFER to stay with a developer when I have been with them from the beginning but if I and other users/supporters are not being heard, then maybe deleting the App will be “heard”? 
It isn’t like you’re a 6 month old App. C’mon. You ask and we tell. Talking to deaf ears is frustrating, I’d know after 4 husbands.

Yes I wish the app wouldn’t shut off so often for no reason.  I suppose your team is working on this right now!  
But the real upgrade that would be SOOO great is : a LOCKED MODE. So that one can search within the note/page/drawing without the constant threat of modifying it unwillingly.  Because for this very reason, I am looking for a replacement.
I would not have willingly installed this shovelware that they snuck into an OS update

I spent a load of time creating a board on my iPad but cannot share it as I will not sync. I’ve tried all of the work arounds and it won’t work 
Leaving on my trip tomorrow so back to old school 😑

This is one of the better drawing and idea apps I have ever used. 

Currently it doesn’t allow snap shapes so when want to draw a straight line or a square for example, it doesn’t do it automatically like it does in notes. Once this is fixed this app will be 100% the best.
Drains my iPad battery when it’s the only app open. Needs to be better optimize so it’s not a resource sink. Ipad gets quite hot when the app is in use.

As others have said I too welcomed this addition thinking of how I could draw lists and quickly mind map ideas with a tool that helps. But oh dear you very soon encounter the laggy and glitchy response to pencil that other have said, I tried it on both iPad Pro 12,9 and iPad mini. It’s same so it’s in the code. 

What makes it totally useless though is that saved page when viewed on another device has gaps and random line moved elsewhere making reading pen written content impossible. 

Why not look to what apps like Notability do and make a simpler version?? 

It seems it is a beta version at very best. Bug filled and underdeveloped for obvious features. Not what expect from Apple or is it….?
Apple fixed the issue of overheating and lags. Thanks apple, will review again in a few days.

column9: Like the idea but feels not finished
column10:
Started use it for some of my notes for learning. I love zooming possibilities so I can write a list with large font and make tiny annotations to it. Problem is that it is buggy - somtimes lines disappear. Bug that really annoys me: When I want to paste something (from another app - flexcil2) I tap in empty space and have an only option to “select all”. So I have to select all, then deselect and tap again to get “paste” option in popup menu. Also it lacks auto shapes and some brishes from notes.

Reduced rating to one star after opened my file on iPhone and some of lines disappeared so it’s not possible to read.

Sorry but this app is just not good enough for the Apple ecosystem. The Pencil integration is woeful with no pressure sensitivity. It feels like an absolute chore to write or draw anything in this app because it’s so laggy. What’s the use of an unlimited board when after writing maybe 5 paragraphs of text the entire app starts lagging to the point that it’s unusable, your iPad gets too hot to hold and the battery drains faster than it can charge with the standard iPad charger.

Not to mention really basic functionality like folders missing making it an organisational nightmare and buggy syncing.

10 things that apple needs to fix with this app for it to be something that’s worth using over competitors like [ Mural ]!

1. An windows equlivent APP!! I don’t care if it’s accessed via web or launched via iTunes, I just want to see the roadmaps I planned out on my PC! 

2. UI needs to change!! First of all, make it “endless” (atleast ONE visible element has to on screen at all times, otherwise you can get lost), then remove the scrollbars, add tripple finger tap to recenter to “middle” (not middle of the canvas, middle of all elements)!

And a “settings” menu that allows us to 3, 4.

3. DARK MODE!!!

4. Customized shortcuts for Find, UNDO, REDO, Outline, Place previous element, Use custom color (infinite, aslong as there are shortcuts available), these are just the things I use on a daily basis but I bet there’ll be more to add!

5. Offer something more. This is complete garbage for people who don’t use this kind of app to organize their stuffs but for us who do, we already have an app that we use, let us import photos/pdf, and have somekind of algorithm that can split up unique shapes into “elements”!

6. Again offer something more! Like advanced color sampling, instead of the basic boring default colors, give us colors sampled off of the imported image so it sticks to the theme! 

7. UI !!! What on earth is this user interface!? Change the enite bottom slab to something like the dynamic Island that pops up when you select an element, that thing looks a thousand times better! 

Top slab should just be like the search bar on safari, minimize when not in use! 

8. Color match the generic BLUE ICONS to the theme that’s on the canvas!!! Or atleast make the black since it goes well with just about any theme! Why on eart did you guys pick BLUE!?!?!? It’s an eyesore!!!

9. Why does 3D touch not do anything??

10. No calculator on iPad. So why is this ph iPhones!? It’s too small to be useful what’s worse is that YA NEVER FIGURED OUT HOW TO RETAIN DIMENSIONS WHEN JUMPING ACROSS FROM IPAD AND IPHONE!!!!

column9: Please edit to be able to flip the photo…
column10: Please edit to be able to flip the photo…

This app has so much potential but falls so short in really disappointing ways. 

No option to rotate images, no option to adjust image opacity, no option to free crop (you’re stuck with the four corners and can only crop vertically, horizontally and diagonally… but good luck if you just want to erase a small part of an image). 

Honestly pretty ridiculous considering how powerful this app could be to limit it like that. But that’s Apple for you….

Guess I’ll just be going back to Snapseed.

column9: I think it needs some work

column9: Great potential, but needs more love
column10:
I enjoy using this app, however my biggest issue is that drawn lines don’t sync across devices. If you draw/write more on one device, it seems only about two-thirds sync across all others. In some cases, they even disappear on the original device, making it a really poor tool for note taking.

For the time being, this tool just doesn’t compare to what’s out there. If you’re looking for a free, fantastic alternative for a collaborative whiteboard, I suggest using Figma’s Figjam boards (with the caveat that they can’t be edited on phones).

This app has a lot of potential. I am a teacher and could see myself using this app while teaching lessons to my class but it lacks a few features I would need.

First and foremost the ability to add pages. This is an instant deal breaker for me. Having to setup a new whiteboard for each page is madness. It makes planning a lesson very impractical.

Second - editing the toolbar or just adding more tools in general. Have quick access to the redo button is a must for me as I undo and redo a lot while teaching.

Plenty more but there 2 are the main ones.
It is a good app but every time I get off the app it deletes everything i did. Can you please fix this.
Maybe that happen because the app is new, but i get really upset about it. Hope it wont happen again.

column9: Amazing app ever, still have a little issue,I have a suggestion
column10:
To be frank, I really appreciate that you make this app, it encourage me to do maid-map more, literately, I scarcely do it, but with this app,I will try and try, especially on the iPad with Apple Pencil, it’s convenient and modern, but the current use situation is very unstable, such as handwritten notes too much, will be stuck, and crash; I think it's a little rigid, given that multiplayer collaboration requires a lot more data processing and requires a lot less complexity and playability. My suggestion is that it can be separated. For example, a "share with others" can be added to the Settings. The "Yes" section of the page can give priority to "share", and take away some of the complexity and playability. "No" allows users to create their own random thoughts. I'm sure the iPad pro will handle the personal part more than adequately.
That’s all I want to say, I can’t help saying it’s an amazing app, a wonderful job, although there are already another mind-map apps, but I even don’t give it a look, I think this is the best app ever, thanks to you, thanks to ，❤️

column9: Correction-Already proved itself, until I tried to rotate object…
column10: Following up on my 1st review. Incredibly, you CANNOT “rotate” a drawing or object! It’s really amazing that Apple apps are so consistently disappointing…Google? This is the missing drawing too as well as being a superior organizational tool. My first use was to drop a series of screen grabs to create an investment document. I’ve used and dropped numerous such tools including Paper, which was the best until the new subscription era forced me to drop it. (Cripes, how many subscriptions does Apple think I want to carry!?) But this is better. I made my notes on a stack of images, complete with arrows and full control of top to bottom order (missing in Notability), and exported it as a pdf document into Notability, my go to document storage app. I was about to start another concept exploration and immediately thought to go with Freeform. Thus, I thought it was a good time to show my appreciation with this review. Thanks for doing a good thing Apple. But do fix your date function on documents. I don’t know why this is still an issue seen in people losing work—or just give users back the Save button.

column9: Why do all the pages keep corrupting one by one?!
column10: The pages keep corrupting, and I can’t even open a new page at this point! I’m literally losing hundreds of hours worth of hard work that I painstakingly worked on. And I do mean pain, as I have to work through extreme chronic eye pain and headaches to make my concepts… All to have everything be corrupted and lost in the end! Hundreds of hours of nearly needing to go to the hospital for pain management, all for nothing, all trash?! That’s messed up beyond belief.

I love the concept, simple intuitive layout, and the expandable options of importing many different items is stellar.  
BUT, I’ve now used it for 2 weeks and it’s frozen on me 17 times.  I have to ‘force quit’ and restart.  Since it’s iCloud based, I’d expect it to work seamlessly in the Apple ecosystems, it does not.  It takes an average of 4 to 8 mins to communicate with iCloud, whether I’m using my MacBook Pro (2019) or my 12.9” IPad Pro, (2020).

It’s got good potential and promise.  However, why Apple allowed this product to market with so many fixes necessary is beyond me.  Come on Apple, you’re better then this!

I wanted to use this to help my daughter with her homework when she is with her mom, but there are two problems that make it unsuitable; one and annoyance and one make the product fundamentally unfit for it’s stated purpose:

1. High latency: it can take a long time to update between users. This is annoying but can be dealt with. 
2. Dropped content. When drawing/writing on the whiteboard, roughly half of all content was never transmitted to the other users. This is totally unacceptable as the other users are left with garbled illegible images. It fundamentally fails as a shared whiteboard for this reason.
good app, but on the iPhone 13 mini, it closes itself while painting.

Don't rest your palm on the screen when using Apple Pencil. Also, things like the Undo button being in the upper right corner in Free-Form, but, in Notes it appears at the top of the software keyboard are incongruent, confusing, and frustrating.

column9: Unable to move handwritten sticky notes at same time
column10:
This app needs major work. It cannot be used for any serious work that professionals need.

1. You CANNOT move handwritten notes on Sticky Notes at the same time. If you move the Sticky Note, the handwritten notes remain in place. This is a profound blunder on Apple’s part.

2. No layers like what you get with Concepts app.

3. The sync does not display notes correctly across iPad, iPhone, and Macbook. Handwritten notes on iPad are unreadable on Macbook because for some reason every third or fourth letter is missing.

4. No quick way to link sticky notes or handwritten notes with movable arrows.
I love it hopefully you do to you can make these stuff if you try it I think you would like it but it some how piped on phone but any way but that it is great:)💕❤️

For context, I use it for writing a bunch of equations, and it’ll look great and work great on my iPad, but when I open it up on my Mac, half of the strokes are missing and not even the latter have written; it will have half of the strokes I just made, so that everything is illegible and unusable. Cloud syncing is one of my top priorities in a note taking app, so it becomes just unusable for me. Quite disappointed, hope they figure it out.

column9: No two tap undo, zooming is janky, cant rotate canvas
column10:
This app is almost perfect. 3 things:
-undo/redo: you have to manually click buttons for this under the pencil menu. It’s pretty unbelievable you can’t undo and redo with two/three finger tap.
-zooming is kind of broken on iPad. Not smooth at all, hard to explain but it needs to be better.
-unable to rotate the canvas as you think you could using two rotating fingers. 

All of these things an app called Concepts can do, and it’s overall the better app. The thing about Freeform I like is how minimal the interface is, and doesn’t sacrifice too much in features. But those 3 things make it frustrating to use at times.

I love using this for making vision boards. I can add shapes and text boxes easily. It came with my iPad when I updated it and I really like the app. I have issues sending my creations to other people who Apple products which is my only issue. I’m a heavy user of Miro, Graphwiz… I believe these are the products that Freeform aspire to compete with? However this feels like someone built during a hackathon and Apple then decided to launch. It is really heavy to work with. For instance you can’t anchor objects to each other. In order to create an arrow you need to go an select a line object.

column9: I want this app to work!
column10: It’s so close to being amazing, but needs serious work. Lag is SO bad that you can barely write with pencil. This happens 100% of the time when your document starts to hold any substantial size (RAM issue?) It’s so bad that your handwriting becomes basically illegible. For comparison, the writing in apple notes is still smooth, fluent and “REAL-TIME”. This means that a smooth Freeform is possible, but nowhere near ready yet. This app is the only reason I got an iPad so patiently waiting for a hot fix. PRO TIP: the only thing I’ve found that works is creating an additional document everyday which prevents the lag. Of course this defeats the purpose of an endless canvas, but at leaaat it kinda works.

You’ve got the absolute best pencil, why not use it? Adding pressure/tilt sensitive for at least opacity and/or size is kind of a must.  

For visual conceptualisation that would be so much better.

Overall, I do like Freeform and am thinking of continuing to use it, but it would be nice if my iPad didn’t overheat and if the app didn’t lag so much as I add more content to the board(s).

Short and straightforward, I use a Mac for work and I recently purchased an iPad. I’ve been using Freeform on my Mac to keep all my stuff together, keep track of what’s done and what needs to be done, follow-ups, all of it. I was excited to use Freeform on both my Mac and iPad - I had a hard time syncing my boards, kept taking long, kept saying I needed to wait for it to sync. I finally get to a point where it’s so close to syncing and WOOSH - just like that, all important notes, important everything on all my different boards -GONE. I recommend using MIRO or other better apps that won’t do that to you. It was a stressful situation and I’ve not used Freeform since. I don’t recommend trying to sync between devices unless you’re okay with losing whatever you have. Not worth the risk in my opinion.

I think it is a cool idea, but could use some improvements. First off, if the overall template/graphing paper is so large, why does the width of the marker only go so high? I think there should be a slider to show the width so it can accommodate with your preferences. If i write something down, like a heading or title for my Freeform, it is so skinny and can hardly be seen. So that needs to be fixed. Also what happened to the highlighter from Markup? The highlighter was one of my personal favorite tools to use when editing some school assignments, etc.; and especially since I might be using Freeform for school brainstorming, I think that the highlighter should be included. This isn’t like a flaw or anything but it baffles me that there are two crayons, a big one and a little one. Back to my slider width point, if that was added, you could merge both of those tools into one and add some room for a new tool. Just saying.
How is it possible that you didn’t add a pencil for Mac’s version?! 2 starts is enough.
The app is really good for planning things, but I think there should be some templates.

This app is awesome. It lets me write down things I must remember in the future. This app also helps me write down plans. The cool thing with this app is it has so many cool things you could add to your notes. For example, if I wanted to make my notes look cool, I could add a sticky note! You could also change the color of your sticky note if you desire. But that’s not all. This app also has shapes. You may be thinking “that’s it?” No, not just shapes, it has places, people, animals, activities, science, arts, transportation and so much more cool emojis. It makes your notes looks so much nicer than just the plain old notes app. You can draw on your notes, you can add text boxes. It is just such a cool addition and it really helps you stay organized. If you want an app that helps you stay organized than you must download this app!

*General*
I‘m quite disappointed by Apple. I have never witnessed an app from Apple as buggy as Freeform. I use Freeform to draw letters (lettering) and the app barely can handle more than 10 letters before the file becomes no longer useable. 

*What makes it potentially buggy*
The letters consist of many short and long strokes and fills. Nonetheless I would expect an Apple app do be performant enough to handle this. It‘s not a one-off experience. It‘s happening over and over again.

*Why I use Freeform*
I prefer this app for drawing letters over Procore because I love sharp outlines (vector format) and the erasers features (object- and pixel- eraser) are super handy when lettering.

column9: A few other features would be nice.
column10:
This app is generally helpful when creating presentations or idea boards, but I have come to find that it is not particularly useful for artistic projects. There are many features that would be helpful for people who plan on using this app for art, but aren't included in the app (as of now).

 Seeing as I myself am an artist who looks forward to using this app in the future, a few of the tools and features that I think would be helpful for those purposes are "layers", different pens, paint brushes, and markers, a wider variety of brush sizes that could contribute to a more efficient art process, and a blending tool.

A "layering" tool would be very helpful for creating a new and improved draft over a sketch, and being able to create a detailed piece of art with multiple layers each dedicated to colors, an outline of your first draft, and a sketch, or whatever use layers may have in different scenarios. 

A wide selection of art tools can result in both a more realistic looking art piece, or a more clearly digital art piece depending on preference.

When using this app to draw, specifically when drawing over images, having more than 5 tools would be helpful, especially considering the scales and sizes of different images.

A blending tool is something that I, as well as many other artists, would like to add to some art pieces, so having a blending feature in this app would really come in handy.

After pointing out a few of the things that could improve the productivity of this app, I would like to thank you for taking the time to hear out my ideas of ways to make this app more convenient for those who intend to use it for art purposes.

First off, Freeform has great potential.  It worked great for communicating ideas and collaborating in real time using iPads and Macs.  However it is unusable for real world work.  I watched as a user ungrouped an object to edit something and the object disappeared for them and across all devices!  This item on the whiteboard included an entire day’s collaboration.  A day’s work, including insights and new ideas, lost forever.  I tested the scenario with the latest update and all devices updated, and the flaw still exists.  Poof.  This is a non starter for businesses and for any serious work.   This exposes a major flaw: the data behind the whiteboard is not handled in a robust way.  

1) No way to back up work.  Your work is not stored in files, it’s in a database in the cloud with some local hidden copy.  This database doesn’t have versions for rollback or recovery.  

2) The more complex the whiteboard, the harder it is to know what has simply disappeared and what was purposefully removed.  I have Zero confidence in the integrity of Freeform whiteboards.

I love the idea of Freeform and I played with it enough to know it can really enhance collaboration and efficiency.  I got hooked on the concept and fortunately was able to come up with a much more robust way to do most things using Affinity Designer.  It uses files which are easily backed up via Time Machine and other methods.  Work integrity is rock solid.  The workflow and ease of use isn’t as good as freeform, but the output is as good or better and work doesn’t vanish.
