column9: pretty good, can use some changes
column10:
I use this to take notes in class, do hw, and just jotting down things as i go, mainly because i prefer writing things myself as opposed to just typing them. it's a pretty decent app for what it's meant to do. 
    i've seen some people just lose work randomly. i always make sure to save important things as pdfs to my files, so i recommend doing that until they fix the issue.
    as someone who draws, i think people's suggestion of double/triple tapping for undo/redo would be a great addition to this. 
    i am BEGGING for you guys to add the option of making folders to organize your stuff. since i use this to take notes in class, i would love to be able to organize my files so i dont have to scroll down through random files just to find my notes. 
    someone people have suggested adding pen pressure settings, and despite being happy with the pressure i have, i would also like this addition to happen. sometimes im writing too fast and the words become hard to read so i have to rewrite then, this wouldn't happen if i could adjust the pressure exactly to what i like. 
    
this is more picky stuff that i would like to see.
    selection tool- to be able to add more to the current selection rather than having to go back and select everything. same with unselecting. after selection something, sometimes i notice that i selected something else by accident and i have to reselect everything again. if i could switch the tool to unselect then i could just get rid of the unwanted stuff much more easily. 
    layers- i think adding layers would be AMAZING, im not sure if the infinite canvas poses a limit to this, but if it doesn't then i would love to see it!! doodling in this app is very fun. i know you can push things forwards and backwards, but it would be much easier if i could just see the layers myself instead of guessing. sometimes when i move things forwards or backwards, either nothing happens or im not given the option to do so (especially when i add post it notes!).

overall, i think this app has a lot of potential! i know it came out not long ago, so i look forward to the new changes that will be added in the future i hope mine and other people's suggestions are part of those changes

The drawing features themselves, I have nothing to complain about. I would have left a 4-5 star rating if not for the fact that this app crashes every single time I use it. It causes my iPad to freeze on occasion, and the screen doesn’t respond when I touch it.

I really do hope Apple makes these improvements because this app does really have potential to be a game changer with students and working professionals alike.

column9: Good Start to a Promising App
column10: I am pleased that Apple has developed a note-taking app where it is easy to switch from drawing on my iPad to typing. I suggest that it becomes possible to have folders and sub-folders of the boards so it is easier to organise notes. I would use this to organise revision subjects, I am currently using Microsoft one note for this however I would use freeform instead if folders were introduced as it is a less glitchy app and better designed for using Apple Pencil.

I was excited about using Freeform for personal use before release, but felt underwhelmed on my first impression, putting it off until later. After coming back to it, getting more used to the features, and putting it into practice, I gotta say I enjoy it a lot. 

As with all the Apple productivity apps, there are a few features I wish it had along with some cross-app compatibility with the other Apple productivity apps (Notes, etc.). With that said, I really enjoy the simplicity and intuitive nature of their apps, Freeform included.

I’m not using it for collaboration purposes, but I am using it for things like shopping lists, todo lists, kanban boards, budgeting, vision boards, brainstorming, mind-mapping, and other things.

For these personal purposes, it works great for “right-brained” type individuals, those with more non-linear thinking, creatives, 
ADHD, etc. Having all your stuff on one board makes it easy to keep track of stuff from a “big picture” view, rather than having to dig through a bunch of Notes folders or Reminders.

column9: One Simple Thing Holding It Back For Me
column10:
I would love to dive into this app more to see how it compares with other similar products like FigJam, but unfortunately I was almost immediately not interested because of one tiny feature that for some reason Apple doesn’t have in any of it’s products that function with Apple Pencil.

The double finger and triple finger taps to undo/redo.

I know it might sound ridiculous to stop using an entire app because of a feature like that, but it really is such an intuitive and seamless function that saves time and helps me focus on my work. I’m not taken out of the flow to locate the undo button and then tap it every time I need to adjust something. 

There are so many other apps that do everything this app is trying to do and ones like FigJam already have the undo/redo tap built in. If it’s gonna break my flow and increase stress then I’m using what I already have and not even going to try an explore something new until they match what I need.

I have been using this app for quite a while now . While the interface is easy to use there are some quite annoying problems  -

1.There no scale and it gets very annoying to use lines and it’s take a whole lot of time to set them in an irregular angle . 

2.While drawing with hand the absence to quick snap into geometric shapes turns the whole process into a mess .

3.The select tool has a very messy interface , it gets laggy and also glitches often times I use it .

The app improve significantly if the issues are resolved.

I’ve been using this app mostly for drawing since I don’t have a use for the whiteboard/sharing aspect function, which sounds very cool. The 400% zoom is quite useful - I use that practically constantly for details and it’s really great.

Reasons I gave only two stars:
1. This app is missing some very basic Apple tools. No snap to shapes, like in Notes, or ruler, like in photo editing? Come on.
2. The app is laggy. When I move my point of view on my drawings around to work in a new area, the image usually takes several tries to move then will jump to the new spot, often showing an older version of the drawing before the newer version ‘snaps into focus’. This interferes with my ability to smoothly move from area to area as I draw.
3. The app crashes. A LOT. It will sometimes start to freeze and crash at shorter and shorter intervals until it can’t be used at all.

This app has great potential. I’m so very disappointed in it right now.

Felt as though I should give the app two stars for the single reason that it functions for the first hour. 
I’m on iPad pro 2020 and this app downloaded with my most recent update. Given that it’s an Apple endorsed app, I expected it to at least work with Apple products. I chose to use it to make a mind map for my exam revision, and after putting around three hours of work into my notes it became completely unusable. Below is a list of the issues:
- EXTREME lag. This seems to get worse with the more you add to the board. If an app supports a large board like this one, it should at least be able to cope with the writing that would fill the board. 
- The lasso tool doesn’t work the majority of the time. When I’ve lassoed a section, the board doesn’t let me move it and instead just scrolls around. 
- When scrolling around the board, anything that was previously off-screen takes SECONDS to render. Again so disappointing when the app supports a large enough board. It should be able to cope with the board being filled. 
- Generally limited tools. I was really surprised to find that there was no ruler function, or even a function for autocorrecting lines, curves, arrows etc. When most other Apple apps have these functions it seems very strange that this one doesn’t support it. 
- Palm detection seems completely messed up. Having to roll up my sleeve so that I don’t inadvertently move things does not seem like an Apple-level piece of software. 
- Once I had realised the app wasn’t going to work, it wouldn’t let me export my work to my more trusted notes app…or anything for that matter!! It came up with some error message about not synching to the cloud, but by this point it was so laggy that I couldn’t even copy and paste the notes into somewhere else!
While the app has potential, it is currently nowhere near as usable as it needs to be - while it is bug free as far as I can tell it is just incredibly slow and feels as though it has not been through testing to actually ensure it can keep up with its specification. I feel very disappointed having put so much work into these notes only to have to delete them. 
For anyone looking for an app like this which actually functions, I would suggest Notability. Never had any issues with lagging or anything on that.

For reference boards, vision boards, planning, mind maps, notes. 

-The biggest perk is being able to markup and type text directly on the board on Freeform. Being able to write and doodle and draw out anything necessary is a big plus over Vizref. It is the main feature Vizref cannot do.

-I prefer the dark mode Vizref offers and I like that Vizref lets you upload a single image as thumbnail for a board. Freeform doesn’t allow that. The zoomed out board is the thumbnail so it just looks like a tiny smattering of things jumbled together as a thumbnail.

-Freeform is laggy when zooming out and in or panning large distances. Vizref is snappy. You can zoom out and in more in Vizref than Freeform, which has a cap on the zoom out. 

-I prefer the pasting and editing tools in Freeform for pasting in, cropping, resizing, locking, and otherwise editing images in the board. It has good snapping features too. However, Vizref has a convenient locking button that locks the whole board easily if you’re wanting to pan around without potentially moving an image. In Freeform you have to lock and unlock each image manually. 

-in Freeform you cannot turn off the stylus pencil feature and use it interchangeably as a hand tool, it always draws everytime you touch it to the page. I like that in Vizref I can pan the canvas with the stylus.

-Freeform offers a library of icons and shapes to place on your board as well as text. Vizref does neither.

-I really wish Freeform let you change the background to a dark mode, or color slider for the background. Vizref has a dark and light mode. I also like the grid style of Vizref better than Freeform. I wish it would have an option to pick between dot grid or line grid; light mode and dark mode.

-Freeform lets you upload to icloud and share, but I have not used this feature and have icloud off.

As it stands I think freeform actually wins but theres a few quality of life things that I would miss like dark mode and the snappier interface of Vizref. I like picking a thumbnail too for each board. I already have boards on Vizref app so I may continue to use it or may take the time to remake boards on Freeform. It’s a good app.
The pens are really simple so i love to doodle, surprisingly my small little sketches look better here than on other apps i usually draw on

This is a nice app for planning arrangement of a collage.  It has decent capabilities but needs some tweaks.
- need to be able to lock objects together so they can be moved as a unit.
- better controls to rotate an object

One evening the app closed on it’s own and when I reopened it i had ‘no boards’, nothing saved, nothing recently deleted, nothing backed up, nothing on my other devices, nothing on my cloud drive. After searching the web in hopes of an ansewr, I learned that this is happening to so many users, and like me they could not figure out why or how to retrieve their projects. I also wish I could cut out an image or a part of a image.

As per usual, Apple comes to a great start. However, some more features would be great for power users so I can replace OneNote.
1. Set image as background option.
    While yes, you can lock images it would be nice to permanently set something as a background so you never accidentally click it. Make it a layer in settings maybe?
2. Give the option to limit the grid size.
     While the concept of infinite expansion is cool and should stay in, the option to lock the size of the grid would be nice so you don’t accidentally scroll away from something when handling like a map etc. Either that or a way to lock the “camera” so you can’t scroll away/zoom.
3. Make a way to group boards.
     I should be able to group individual boards into “folders” so I can keep multiple workspaces for each individual project, and that would also make it easier to add people to multiple boards.
4. Dark Mode because it’s 2023.
5. Air Drop support, because it’s 2023.
6. Enable smaller sticky notes, or increase printout sizes for documents. 
     I stretch a standard paper sized PDF so I can make sticky notes small enough, and sometimes I get it wrong and have to go back in and fiddle with it.

- mindmaps 
- more smooth drawing as it in default notes app

let me start off by saying that i’m a huge fan of the notes app. i know it sounds silly, but it’s such an awesome writing space and i use it on a near-daily basis. so freeform isn’t too different, but it’s definitely a neat app. it has a lot of the same features as notes, like writing, drawing, and syncing in real time, but there are some cool new features that notes doesn’t have. for example, it’s more of a free-flowing app than notes. it’s as organized as you want it to be, or not at all (also the weird emoji-type-shapes are for sure worth checking out lol). i’d say it’s cool so far, pretty much just what i’d expected, but there is one huge thing that i’ve been hoping will happen for some time that didn’t come with this app. one of the main functions of the boards are that you can draw on them, yet apple pencils still can’t sync with iphones! i know that i could just purchase a cheap stylus, but it’s just not the same (sensitivity issues). so i guess i’m just wondering if making apple pencils connect with phones is anywhere in the near future for apple? i understand if it competes with ipads or something, but i just think it’d be a pretty sweet feature to have. …also dark mode would be cool 🙃. overall, cool app, thx so much!!

column9: Great concept. Excited for its potential!
column10:
This app is very fun to use however I feel like it has a lot of potential that it could be living up to. It would be cool if it had a more complete set of pens to work with along with (especially ones that work well with pressure sensitivity from Apple pen such as the ✨fountain pen ✨) 
Also, I feel like many of the ideas listed in other reviews would be wonderful such as adding gradients to the stickers and being able to hand write on the sticky notes. Fun for personal study projects and hopefully, as it continues to improve, it will be more useful to people in a more professional setting

This app is a great start but is missing a few key things, especially with Apple Pencil, which is $99 but I could be using a free stylus pen that I found on the ground and it would work the same. 

The pencil is amazing because of the pressure sensing (changing line thickness based on pressure), but this doesn’t appear to have any effect in Freeform. Also, in the NOTES app, when I make a shape and hold at the end of it, it turns into a perfect version of the shape, but in the app that is ACTUALLY DESIGNED FOR DRAWING, it doesn’t work!!! What?!? 

As I use it more and more, I just find myself expecting features to be there, and then they aren’t. I get Freeform is early in development, but these features need to be added, please.

I really love the legroom that this app provides! If I need to jot things down but don’t want to use your notes app, this is such a great alternative! Inserting images is easy as well as adding text! There’s plenty of room to work with and all of the features are smooth.
As any app like this is first launched, I’m sure there will be more programmed into its capabilities. 
One of my top recommendations would to make night mode accessible. I utilize it often on all of my apps and it’s visually pleasing!
Super basic, unable to get the share feature to work… Everything seems laborious… But at the same time it feels like it could work? At this point Iowa will not be using.

column9: It’s very nice, but has its flaws
column10: I usually is this for doodling, but if there is too much stuff on the drawing it ends up glitching and then closing. I feel like just with a little more work this could be perfect, but for now it’s kinda just mediocre.

So sad to see Apple releasing half baked apps still. Steve jobs is rolling in his grave. Trying to use the text feature and there’s so many issues around pasting, direct cursor placement, typing, text formatting. Selecting items. The functionality of the app is meh. I am happy with the intro of this app. I think we all need it but please, take the time to test on all of your SKUs and work to make text editing better. Also procreate still has a better handwriting “sensitivity” as Freeform looks quite scribbly and does not have the finesse that Procreate has. Not to mention the tap to undo/redo is an expected functionality that just sucks. Why are you making us press buttons for such common tools.

Edit: the more I use the app the more upset I get with Apple. Completely different uses depending on the platform. Like text editing; on iOS you have all your text formatting tools at a tap. Instead on desktop you have to click through and then it opens up that dreaded archaic text formatting modal box that hasn’t been redesigned since the 90s. Are you training UX students or something? Consistency is a really powerful constraint that helps make the UX smooth. 

Also have to mention how terrible the desktop app is. You’re making me use my left hand to press hotkeys such as “command + +” to zoom. With an app that is very cursor centric, where is the simple scroll modifier here? Allow users to use mental models around this that every other design app uses. 

Mind blowing how badly this is designed? Are you going to tell us it’s because you plan it to be used exclusively with touch screen (maybe future touch screen laptops?) blasphemy.

I am feeling hopeful about this app. But there are still tools that it needs. It needs a ✋ tool so that you can move the canvas around without selecting anything it also needs a 🔍 + and 🔍- tool so you can zoom in and out of the canvas. It also needs a way to separate things that get grouped together. Such as when 🖍️ using the crayon or another tool to write and then it all clumped together when you don’t want it to be. Perhaps a 📌 so that you can pin individual images and drawings. 🏘️ it also needs a grouping tool so when you want to you can select 📍 and then 🏘️ things together. Lastly it also needs a 📚 tool so you can put things in front of or behind each other. I am really hopeful about this app but all of these things make it frustrating because it hinders the creative process

This app is phenomenal for collaboration environments, but I wish it had a feature to live record and follow along with my writings as I go. Recording, pictures, and scanned documents or slides from a classroom projector - need better integration. This would be a phenomenal app for classroom environments if all those features were added. don’t know why these feature was released as early as it was but it’s hella laggy, has bugs that cause it to quit unexpectedly, and the shared canvas doesn’t work as well as it probably should (to put it simply, of 100 strokes on the original owner of the doc, only 5 show up to anyone that it’s been shared to). overall all though, i’ve wanted a concept like this for a really long time, and it’s good that you introduced the idea, but it needs a lot of work before it’s anything close to people’s expectations.
The original Notes app sketch tool (which allowed zoom) was better than this, with smooth pencil shading included. Why not just give us back this app in Notes?

I’m disappointed. This tool works, and if you have enough patience to navigate the controls to select, insert, resize, color etc eventually you can build some sort of a diagram. But isn’t that so 1990s? I’d expected a tool a lot more amazing from Apple. I’d expected to draw directly with my finger, and truly enjoy the kind of freedom I have in front of a real whiteboard. Apple please take a look at excalidraw, and Algodoo in its way to draw perfect geometry shapes with just a mouse/finger, and many other modern whiteboarding tools. column9: Swiss Army knife of an app
column10:
Freeform is maybe the best all-around “get-it-done” tool I’ve seen ever. I’ve tried so many different task apps and note taking tricks, none of which seem to stick, but I immediately fell in love here. Haptic feedback on the MacBook and an infinite plane for me to work on is just incredible. I’ve already started using it for my classes this semester with both note taking and homework.

Freeform already has some incredible features, but for skeptics, it will obviously improve immensely with time as this is only the very first release. Extremely excited.

I thought maybe it could just be my iPad. The experience on my 2022 MacBook Pro is not much better. When I open the same project on the MacBook Pro I’m finding there are pencil markings that are not present when I open my iPad. Opening the Freeform boards is just as slow.

If the app were stable it would be a 4/5, but it’s currently unusable.

Freeform is another entrant in the whiteboard app space but has the huge downside of only being able to collaborate with others that are using Apple devices. A huge advantage to similar tools such as Miro, Mural and Figma’s FigJam product is being able to simply send a URL to a team member and jump into a jam session with them. 

For now it seems Freeform merely checks a “capability box” in Apple’s productivity suite and is nothing more than a fancy toy like much of Apple’s iWork ecosystem.

Also, I have a really big board with a lot of annotations and every time I wan to pan it or add something it lags a lot, the response is really slow and sometimes it crashes. I guess there’s really no point in having and infinite canvas if your board is not going to support much information.

column9: The more you use it, the worse it gets.

So many creatives are looking forward to this and hopefully want to rely on this within both personal and professional formats. Apple please don’t let us and anyone else with a creative spark down.

column9: Good idea. Would work with some adjustments. Also is very glitchy and hard to share things.
column10:
I was very excited for this app. Upon opening it I was disappointed. 
	For one, there’s the lack of Apple Pencil usability. There’s no highlighter tool (which would be especially useful for this app), just a paint tube tool that doesn’t show up anywhere else and is hard to use. There’s zero pressure sensitivity or shape snapping, and the top size is not nearly as thick as I’d like for the pen. To draw any thick lines you have to use the paint tube. It goes underneath any other lines drawn and works kind of like a traditional selection tool in that you gray a line and it fills in the rest for you with a straight or curved line. It’s hard to get any detail with this tool. The pen tool also does not have pressure sensitivity like the one in Markup.
	The text boxes are incredibly annoying. They spawn extraordinarily small, and it’s hard to resize them because all of the corners are so close together, making it difficult to click an individual one. To edit the formatting, you have to click on the border on an individual text box. you will see a small tab pop up where you clicked with options to change the font, size, and add lists. Any changes you make in this tab apply to the whole text box, meaning you can’t italicize, bold or underline individual words like in most apps. This tab should be on the top where the text, shape and other things are so you can make changes to individual words and it’s easier to access. Another thing that has been annoying is when you type in a text box and it exceeds the size, it expands both ways instead of down, meaning you have to move it around once you’re done so it doesn’t overlap with other things. The text boxes should only expand down, there’s no reason for it to expand up as well. I will say that the copy/paste style feature that allows you to make any text the same font and size as other existing text is useful, although I wish there were a way to save them to the system as custom headings, subheadings and body styles.
	What’s more, the app has been extremely glitchy as soon as I turned on iCloud for it. The default setting was that iCloud was turned off, meaning I couldn’t share or store boards in iCloud. I wanted to send a board I had been working on to someone else, so I turned on iCloud. I then went back to Freeform to share the board and the share option was greyed out. When I tried to click on it, I got a notification saying that the document has not synced yet. There was also a considerable difference in the speed and functionality of the app. Everything was lagging and the undo button was also greyed out. When I tried to restart the app and open it again it took a full minute to start up and the issue continued. I’m going to try restarting my device next, but I do not have high hopes.
	I’m currently using this to work on a project, and I like being able to use the Apple Pencil side by side with text and images in a way that’s harder for notes. The expanding canvas is also helpful, although I wish it was infinitely expandable instead of having a maximum size. However, the lagging and difficulty in using the Apple Pencil and text makes me think it isn’t worth it. I won’t be using this app again anytime soon until they come out with an update improving these features.

I wouldn’t say it’s an unlimited whiteboard, as it can’t really handle too much. Things I write with my apple pencil randomly disappear, I have to rewrite things constantly and I’m not collaborating with anyone at this point. I’m trying to use it to help me plan my days and it just crashes nonstop, trying to load the board I’m working on takes forever, it is glitchy when scrolling around the board and so slow. I haven’t used any other whiteboard programs so I was excited to try this. I’m not sure if this is something all whiteboard programs struggle with either but I really wish this were better, crossing my fingers that subsequent updates help improve it. As another reviewer said “it’s not ready for prime time” sadly.

Also, color coordinate each new board for easy find would be great.

I love virtual boards. As it is now, it’s not great. A good start is to bring in the tools and features from Notes. In the future, maybe we can have a collection of diagram templates, more color for sticky notes, and framing like Miro app. Love the idea of Freeform, it has the potential to be great.
You can’t back up boards.  Hum…why make a document controller for this instead of individual files?  Terrible choices here.
This is too platform-specific to be professionally viable. It needs a web frontend for sharing and presenting.

column9: Excellent, simple to use and share.
column10: Only addition I would like to add is to have a hidden folder similar to photo app. That way when sharing in person; only the project being discussed is shown.
This has some varieties of what to do but for example the shapes vector you can’t turn them right side up and there are other features missing too. Not much to with it.

I was expecting this app so much, and I started making my anatomy notes there, since it was supposed to be an infinite whiteboard app, so I could have all the correlating structures next to each other, which would make studying so easy. But after some days of using it, it has reached a place where it is SUPER LAGGY, to a point where I wait more than 5 minutes just to open the board, and another 5 minutes to load all I’ve managed to write… Let alone the fact that when it manages to open, navigation is slow at best, and the iPad gets extremely hot, while consuming battery A LOT. I have an iPad Pro M1, it’s not a bad machine, but apparently the code of the app needs updating or the iPad I have is just not good enough, which would be also disappointing…
Not everyone has a Mac machine for work. Needed to share a board with colleagues but there isn’t browser support. Not really useful for collaboration if it isn’t accessible to everyone…
Pretty, pretty, pretty, pretty good! Get the dark mode and it will be sublime!
It’s a great app, but it’s really laggy even in a great iPad, it sometimes doesn’t sync in between users and, it just doesn’t feel “apple”.

column9: lot of work to do…. not to Apple quality
column10:
I find it a bit of an embarrassment that Apple is not able to streamline this app like the rest of Apple apps.

Very  simple features are missing or are inconsequent with what might be expected, especially given it has some similarities with Apple Notes:

- Can’t organize your notes in folders
- No ruler 
- No shape recognition
- Impossibnle to draw a arrow and attach it to a part of your drawing  (ok sketch) and make a note (line connects but its somewhere on the outside of your sketch).
- Zoom issues
- Very simple grid (which is either on or off)

As said, nice app, but it feels not finished and lacks quality you would expect from Apple. It’s promising, Apple you can (and should) do better!

I hope they will update it soon and fix a few of these things.

So, I can't make 20 faces shape from basic shape, for example.
There may also need Bezier curve functionality to make some other.

...I as a user want to be able to resize the canvas before printing/exporting 

...I as a user want to be able to use the apple pencil

...I as a user would like to decide how the grid looks (e.g. I want to choose lines instead of dots)
Fantastic in theory. Every attempt to start a collaboration failed. So back into the digital corner it goes until an intuitive use succeeds.
So many buttons to click to draw a thin arrow. Thus far, web-drawing tools win by a large margin
Seems okay,  not competitive with OneNote yet.

column9: Require touch pen support on mac
column10: Require touch pen support on mac and page adding facility in one board …..remaining features and smoothness is ultimate.
I’m missing the mind mapping connector lines to structure data and a library of user made templates, stickers etc. to replace Miro or Figjam if needed

I loved the app, I started using it for my actual school project :D 

BUT I'll like to give some suggestions for the next update:
Could you please add the "tick list" option?

Also, would be amazing if you could implement a calendar-reminder option? Like something to give me specific time notifications included inside each board? For example, I'd like to be able to include a stickie note with a date [and that note be poped-up via a msg in the notification centre in the given date].

I hope this doesn't sound too impossible cause honestly that'd make this app my favourite from the whole app store!!!

column9: Very useful and easy to use
column10: Please, give to the Apple user also the possibility to work in web through iCloud being synchronised with the app

Good Stuff- finally directly from Apple. 
Using on iPad Pro 12.9 - works perfectly. 

One thing I’m missing is a ruler. Would be great to integrate that somehow (house drawing and drafting) 

Keep updating this one.

It’s good that u have developed such app but it lacks few features like auto minimising options while using marker or pen and the board is limited to certain lengths only. It would be better if we could expand the length as much as possible, pls do work on it…
Board doesnt seem to sync across my devices, please fix thank you

I’ve been using the app to simply color. I take a coloring page from the internet and color in with the tools available but apparently the work is too strenuous for the iPad that it actually crashed and malfunctioned my iPad to the point it wasn’t recognizing my finger on the touch screen so I couldn’t even turn off my device. I had to hard reset it and it began working normally again. Even so the Apple Pencil (2nd Gen) lags on normal use.   

For a Pro model that has a strong chip(A12z) even used to run a Mac mini at one point, struggle to color a blank page and eventually malfunction my iPad means this app was poorly made. Apple should be ashamed to release such an unprepared product.
i really recommend it:)
This app is completely useless! It’s a sad pathetic attempt to rip off other great apps. You would give negative stars if I could

I was watching a YouTube video to learn how to use the program and realized that the menu they showed at the top of the board in the video did not appear on my iPad. I looked for a toggle to see if this was a feature that could be shut on and off but I found nothing. I then tried to uninstall and re-install the program from the App Store but the issue persists. Obviously this is not a seriously thought out app. I’ll wait a year to see if the programmers come back from lunch and do the job properly

I had such a good time putting the work together. But I have spent hours attempting to save my work in PDF format or make accessible in good notes but have not been successful not unless I missed a step some how. I also don’t have the same feature options on my iPad that are offered from my phone. My brand new iPad has started closing out of the app itself and it’s only 3 weeks old. Disappointed

column9: Please add an option to erase lines
column10: I have created a scenery with just the shapes option in the app and it turned out pretty good but the only issue i have is, i am not able to erase the overlapping shapes. I wish i could upload a photo to explain what i mean. Please add an option to erase such overlapping shapes which would be a lot helpful.Hope you get what i mean.
It does not synchronize between iPad and Mac ( latest models )

column9: Doesn’t sync so I cannot share any files
column10: This app has all functionality that I need, and I would gladly switch to it from subscription app IF AND WHEN they fix an issue that makes app not sync with iCloud. Without sync it’s pointless. Disappointed that such needed feature of sync doesn’t work!

I’d like to be able to use this app more often, but I struggle to work productively because I can’t create folders to organise my work. It would be create if this could be changed so that I can create folders to store my notes in. Other than that it’s a really good app, I just can’t use it because my notes would be too unorganized.

Excited by this app and it is going to be super helpful. 

However, my boards are not syncing between devices despite numerous restarts and reinstalls. This is a major problem and makes it incredible hard to use the app on the go. 

Also, would love to see features like arrow heads snap to shape and when a shape is moved, it also moves the connecting arrow with it. 

Great idea, but needs some work before it can rival similar tools.
Very good app!
The background moves and that is annoying

I am user of good notes. In my ipad I haven’t faced any lag in good notes app. But, in free for I faced. Apple giving Freeform in free of cost, that’s why it’s quality also low comparing to paid apps.

column9: One of the best iPadOS 16 apps, but with collaboration limits ❌
column10: First of all, I would like to say Freeform might be one of the best apps I've ever used since iOS 10 when I used to use notes and pages. And I also have friends who don't use passcodes on their iPhones and iPads so this is where I ran into a problem when trying to collaborate with one of my friends for a project we were planning on on paper. It restricted my friend to have a passcode, and obviously he did not want to have a passcode he had to remember. Other than my friend's laziness and some collaboration lag issues, I will say this might be my everyday planning app next to reminder for 2023 and maybe further on! Finally after a whole year, you guys made a good app. Good job Apple! 👍

column9: Great idea but the content doesn’t transfer across collaborators or devices
column10: I have been playing with this app since it came out with the iOS update. This would be a wonderful tool except for the facts that other collaborators cannot see what I have inputted into the file. It doesn’t upload to them ever, not just it taking a long time to upload. Also, I cannot see on my phone what I have inputted in on my iPad and vise versa. It has potential to be something useful but it has a lot of growing to do.
Please fix it because if i open always freeze and force closed. I use iPhone 12 Promax

A board I worked on for one hour+ disappeared when my Mac version merged with iCloud data.  Their is no deleted folder and the support instructions refer to a recently deleted folder that doesn’t exist.  Frustrated

I like the idea, and it’d get that it comes with the iPad, but opened an existing board to edit it, and within 2 minutes, experienced glitchy behavior, and pen strokes from my 2nd gen Apple Pencil are not captured on the screen. Even, some of my initial pen strokes disappeared. Thank God I wasn’t too far into my project, but now I’ll have to transfer to another app - Concepts, maybe (though I hate the new pay wall there). Come on Apple, get Freeform together so that we can reliably work.

It is hard to imagine a less useful whiteboarding application for doing anything other than creating silly little drawings. Drawing straight lines, grouping objects and doing anything that requires a higher level of control than a third grader drawing animal shapes is nearly impossible.

I love the concept of this app! It could be very useful in my studies. Here are some of the potential improvements that I've identified: 

- it would be nice to be able to create folders to organize boards
- it would be great to be able to search on handwritten words
- it would also be nice to search within attached files (and possibly images)
it needs some updates , My partner's projects cannot be seen due to the lagging.
Feels like it’s in beta

column9: Drawing with finger although turned off
column10: Although Turned off "Draw with finger" in Freeform app and activated "Only draw with pencil" in Pencil setting, the ipad is still drawing with finger when the hand touched the screen using pencil.

I have only made one creation and I love this app. Everything is so simple to use and is perfect for creating made up fantasy lands. There are so many different things to choose from when making maps or posters or anything you want. Highly recommend especially if you are a dungeon master looking to make simple maps for your home brew campaign ( only people who play DND will understand)

So I updated my iPad Pro to iPadOS 16.2 and when I saw the Home Screen there was an app called Freeform I opened it and it is just so amazing defendly 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟stars and you can draw anything it is so amazing
Very good and functional app good for mixing text and images in a single file/ board. But needs improvement My iPhone freezes frequently when using it.

column9: A Good app with a few things missing
column10: I really do miss having a way of organizing the boards/notes etc. into folders like you are able to in all other notes app. I hope this feature will come in the future.

I like the concept of the app. I hate the sensitivity. Having an undo/redo button will be beneficial. I was able to make a vision board in the app, but it took forever with all of the editing. I’m sure with feature improvements project managers will begin using more frequently.

I would like to have the option to airplay my board to my tv. If we could get that feature that would be GREAT!
I’d like to see the app develop a bit more. Maybe integrate it with Reminders to create Tasks. A bit like MindNode.

It appears Apple higher the Windows 95 team to design this app. 

This is a rare instances where Apple did NOT wait and do it right.

The canvas is offensively bright with no option for a dark mode.

Default shape fills come in a soul crushing Microsoft blue.

By removing auto shape detection, they’ve taken the word “freeform” to self-defeating pedantic levels. 

It is everything that is tiresome about these infinite canvas apps without any redeeming qualities.

The “Notes” app ended up being perfectly functional. Looks like we’re not getting a sequel :(

column9: I was hoping Apple test the software before releasing it …
column10:
The tool is very buggy and really slow. I have notes with about 100 screenshots and now I cna’t really use it anymore. The default zoom in or zoom out shortkeys in other similar tools or other Apple apps doesn’t work in here. Zoom in and zoom out is really slow and takes ages. 

I like the way you can embed 3d files and ebooks, PFD, etc. I don’t know why this is not part of Nots app. This is a natural fit into Notes app. I wish apple added an outliner for each canvas as well, like a text version of the canvas.

column9: Lags, slow and hangs on iPad
column10:
Needs much improvement to reach experience expectations from company like apple. 
There is lag while writing with pencil, it hangs on iPad and takes time to paste pictures.
Not a seamless and promising experience so far.

I think the concept is a good one but as soon as I went to add pictures, the thing wouldn’t work anymore. There were a lot of bugs and I had to reload the page many times before it actually started working again.

Dear Developers, 
 
Thanks a ton for bringing this application on latest iOS, I appreciate your work.

Waiting. for next update.

column9: Slow response with Apple Pencil gen 1
column10: The Apple Pencil is about a 1 second delay when taking notes.  Like others have stated, sync issues.
After trying to use other similar apps like Quicknote5, this app is another genius app from Apple’s stable - excellent job Team Apple.  
this is a great app and i love the idea behind it, but i wish it wasn’t so laggy with the apple pencil. looking forward to more refined updates!

column9: Oh how the mighty have fallen
column10:
I recently just got my new iPad Pro (2018) for the purposes of studying, hence why I downloaded this app. At first it seemed great: I enjoyed the bullet journal background, and I enjoyed the design of it. However, as I have continued to use it more and more it is just really rubbish. As others have said, it doesn’t have the option to group documents together, which is really unhelpful. What is more, after using the app for more than an hour at a time it begins to get really laggy and glitchy. 

More than that, the app is currently frozen on a plain white background which cannot be changed by restarting my iPad. It did get changed by deleting and re-downloading the app. However, once I clicked on my work again it simply froze again and is just a white screen. 

I have decided to either opt for Apple notes or OneNote for my studies. Freeform doesn’t seem to be changing any time soon.

Needs improvement but it’s a really good app, very useful
Add new tools, correct the bugs and lagging
It can’t be read on my device or to iPhones. It’s flickering and won’t able to zoom in….
When my sons phone updated, the update got him this app. And now he loves it more than some of his video games. But he looooooooooves his video games.

I know this app just came out but I think it needs a few things such as different background colours for the boards, the ability to distort objects such and adding more corners to a square and the ability to rotate objects, otherwise this is a great app overall
App crashes when I click/tap and hold on the canvas and then try to tap/click on the Select All option.
Would be great if we have a toggle option for black background.

It’s good but there is some bugs like when zoom in max and moving object it’s lags 
And please add animations il love to see it and more stuff like Microsoft whiteboard

column9: App keeps closing midway of my sketches!!
column10: Great app where i can do cool sketches but annoying that the app keeps closing while in mid of sketching/painting. Please fix!

column9: As basic as it can be
column10:
Craig Federighi once said the reason Apple took so long to bring a weather or calculator app to iPadOS was because they didn’t want to make it unless they could add something to them that would make them truly stand out. Well with FreeForm, we got the long wait but no standout features. In fact barely any features at all. Remarkably it doesn’t even support pen pressure which is frankly unbelievable considering Apple have the Apple Pencil. Why would you make your own product work less well with your own app?

Not only that but it’s lacking other features like a ruler, the UI is cumbersome and you can’t organise boards.

Concepts is a far superior app and if it had real time collaboration which I hope it gets, it would blow this practically useless app out of the water.

The app is very great
I would recommend adding notifications for the implicit in every innovation that occurs in the "file sharing"👌🏻

column9: Excellent idea, horribly buggy and unreliable
column10: Would love this app if it worked. Data doesn’t sync properly across devices, nor with collaborators, and data just disappears for no reason without any way to access via undo or history. So unreliable and frustrating right now. Hopefully things will improve, would love to use this and be able to rely on it, this would be so much better than the notepad app.

First of all, the app crashes unexpectedly quite a lot, especially when zooming into little spots when there are things over the board.
Another issue I have found, that is really inconvenient, is that you cannot make layers. This would be great, and quite simple to implement, I would think.

This app has great potential and I understand that it has just been released, and is still under development.

Thank you for your time

Hi, I understand that this is kind of a new app, but the lagging is just unbearable for me. I’m not even able to zoom in/out sometimes. 
Also, please add more tools and brushes to this.

I can’t use my Wacom to draw in my Mac… I like ta lot the resource “iPhone to draw” this can be very useful… but when I’am in the scene of my work, I wanna use my table to interact with the app.

I’d love to use the app… I was waiting for the launch… but still waiting a great solution, not a windows paint that accept attachments.
nice

All shared notes hand writing gets all messed up on other collaborators to the point where it’s just scribbles and dots; completely unreadable, which defeats the purpose of this app. Add to that the lack of functionality when you compare it with competitors like Mural.
It is fun to show the app with my shiny iPad, but when I wanted to use it for a real project, it is useless.

column9: Much needed and very useful app

Thank you so much for bringing in freeform. There are so many apps out there for corporates but this one serves the need of an individual very well specially coz its part of the unpaid apps!
Please
1) Introduce lasso tool to select multiple objects and move them across the board.And this should work semlessly through the apple pencil. Presently, I am switching between my keyboard, hand and apple pencil to draw the flowchart that i need for my science lesson.
2) It should be possible to selec an object and move it around as can be done on other collaborative boards as Miro.
3) Apple should not limit it to ipad/ iphone users, there should be a browser version as well.
4) Teachers are using ipad to connect to their students. We desperately need symbol input in the keyboardand not have to switch to 3rd party keyboards for doing so. Subscript, superscript?

Eagerly awaiting updates with more user friendly features.
Rotating the text or a image feature is missing
I like it

Missing: paste directly from photo cutout without having to use an intermediary app, and save final board as image.
While the app may be intended to be used for collaborative work, it will be used for meme creation mainly so let's just make things easier 😬
Needs snap to grid funrionality.
Freeform is a wonderful app but it doesn’t have a dark mode. I think Freeform should’ve come with a dark mode. 1 star less for not having a dark mode.

column9: It looks great… but needs more integration
column10:

To be able to have those on the page as actions for the pictures, scribbles etc so it could act as a bullet Journal, health app or planner for project to have the important items right as sticky notes would be a very tool.

If I already have notes or a reminder checklist and calendar appointments of all the items pertaining to the project on screen - could it be done?

column9: Finally an useful drawing app for engineers
column10:

Freeform has been a really refreshing tool to draw conceptual ideas and create new ideas using my smart phone or personal computer. For a free app, I don’t expect it to become the collaboration tool of the century but that feature while still in its infancy is still very useful.

Keep up the good work programmers of Apple software. This device definitively makes me use more Apple devices. I don’t own a apple tablet but should be even better than using it on my phone phone.  

Cheers!

i really love it to make a note using this as it is easy and build up my creativity and also interesting notes but i want a setting for dark ground or any colour.. there should be a setting that i can limit the upper border of the note..

column9: Problems when taking notes across multiple devices

Great concept otherwise, just needs improvements, please! :)
Great app except it’s missing a highlighter pen and the option for a lined and margined background

This is really cool except sorta useless for me since there is no way to save to the storage on your phone. Only options is to share it or save to iCloud. Pretty f dump since I already paid for a 512GB device

There are some good and some bad things about Apple’s Freeform, but they are not worth talking about because the real deal breaker is the poor syncing between devices. That’s it. I can’t work. It’s a show stopper.
Don’t know why this is on my phone, I didn’t install it, here after phone update.

I find Freeform really great. It is the perfect tool for basically anything. The only thing that annoys me to death with freeform is that if you are, for example, naming cities on your map on Freeform and you wright something like Xaewlionbiol the App underlines it red, because it is not a real word. Thats great and okay, the problem is that you cannot get that red line away, by pressing the word and then the appearing button „Add to dictionary“ like in other Apps. So to clarify: by pressing the incorrect word, you cannot add it to your dictionary like in other apple apps like pages.
Can you please correct that, apple?
Thank you

column9: Can’t handwrite on notecards — huge design flaw
column10:
They should call this whiteboard because thats all it is. There is so much potential for this app to be the ideas app that it wants to be: a combined mindmapping and brainstorming app. But any creative person who uses apps like these will find this app to be creayively limiting and, worst of all, slow. It’s slower than just using a notebook and real notecards. First, let users handwrite on the notecards. Give them clipart shapes. Let us doodle within each shape. Then allow us to move and connect and color-code these cards. Such a lost opportunity for apple.

Edit: upgraded to three stars. I can group text to cards and lock cards in place. It’s just not as intuitive or fast as it could be. Note: apple support has told me this was not possible to link the text to a card. Need more user instruction aa minimum.
This is amazing!!!👍😀😛 what I like most about about this app is that you can make anything you want and the logo amazing. Too good that I can’t even give 4 star rating
Zoom in-out and drawing with pen is still laggy

column9: I really like love this app

column10: this is a great app! i love it! i just wish it didn't crash every five seconds 😐
1 Star App until we can change sticky note color to whatever color we want. It’s the only thing that has limited color options. Unusable.

It’s great, I mostly use it for digital art, but I wish there was a blending tool. I think it would be helpful if people use it for art. Other wise, the app is nice. A few lags but nothing major. Overall, I find it fantastic.

column9: Clumsy app with a lot of room for improvements
column10:
I’m surprised that Apple launched this app - it kinda feels like somebody’s weekend project. I like the sticky notes feature but apart from that I am pretty disappointed with everything else.

The main reasons for me to write this review are:
1. iCloud sync seems to be buggy. Changes made in iPad reflect in the Mac app. But not other way round. Now I have this big board in desktop but no way to get them in the iPad. Strangely, editing that board over iPad makes the changes but doesn’t pull the updated content.

2. The zoom in/out bug.
3. Apple Pencil support is pretty bad. Notes app feels much better to use than Freeform
4. Ui is pretty dated
It would be better If the standard pen and pencils of iOS were employed. also, I see lack of folders in the application and it doesn’t support default hold to make a shape

column9: Erm, why isn’t it like notes but better??
column10: Apple notes has made fantastic improvements in its Apple Pencil support and detail. Why doesn’t Freeform have the same (or better) drawing options as apple notes has? For example the fountain pen, or improved pressure sensitivity? The concept of this app is fantastic, but am again frustrated at apple releasing half-baked concepts. For example, in this app you can’t even group “boards” into groups/folders. Great concept (as always with apple), but (as more often the case over the last few years) very poorly executed.

This has been just what I wanted for Mindmaps, sketching and jotting down thoughts. I switched over from another drawing app and I’m sticking with this. The tools are great.

column9: The app has potential but at the moment is very lacking.
column10:
This app has a lot of potential but right now it’s very lacking, many apps already have the infinite canvas with much more input options. Considering we even had to wait for 16.2 I’m disappointed.

The pencil has too little pen option, especially compared to the notes app. It should have at least a pressure sensitive tip, the highlighter, the ruler and the option to press down to create a perfect shape.

I feel like the Apple Pencil should be able to select and change things, but right now it can only draw, this is often uncomfortable. 

It’s also not very keyboard friendly because there’s no many useful shortcuts.

I think there should be more customization in general, like for the background you can’t change the color or have lines instead of dots. It would be useful to have preset fonts easily accessible for things like titles, headings and main text.

Even from the examples on the Apple Store it’s not clear if it should be more Apple Pencil or text based. If they wanted it to be primarily for handwriting and drawing then more kinds of pens are necessary.

column9: Apple, please sort out the bugs
column10: I like the concept of the app, but as of now (couple of weeks after free form was released), the app is filled with bugs. Zooming and panning are a headache and it is missing the automatic lines and shapes that come with other apple annotation apps, like notes. When I draw or write something, it takes a while to appear, and if I pan during that time, the annotation comes in a completely different place. This makes it completely unusable.

A good start and lots of potential however not being able to airdrop between devices is crippling the appp which is directed at creating on the go. Doesn’t Apple know the cloud doesn’t work in many many remote locations? Please please enable airdrop for the files without having to make pdf copies…
There is one little item I would like to have: the ability to lock the size of an object, so that one can not change but still move and duplicate etc.
Unfortunately typical modern Apple software. Tries to do too much and was rushed out the door doing nothing well. Hope the team gets a chance to make it into what they wanted to build.

column9: Sorry Apple, there’s a long way to go
column10: There’s a rule in sales and marketing… something along the lines of if you’re not first, you have to be better. Which is what Apple has been doing in general with their products in general lately. They were SUPER late to the game with home screen customizations such as widgets, but man, do they ever look better than the unregulated mess of random widgets in Android. Getting back to FreeForm, there are a bunch of these types of apps out there, so this should have been something Apple took and improved upon. They missed. Badly. As has been pointed out, even the ridiculously expensive Apple Pencil (which should EXCEL in this type of app) is as basic as your $5 rubber-tipped stylus. It’s really a shame when Apple announces a product, then takes forever to release it, and then you wonder “What the heck were you doing all that time? You had it working when you demonstrated 6 moths ago… why did it take this long, and still underwhelm?” (exhibit 1 - stage manager (still a mess)… exhibit 2 - universal control (took an extraordinary long time)). Too bad, this had potential, but needs an incredible amount of work. Back to the “drawing board”, but a word of advice… don’t use this one. 😉🤣

I have only had PowerPoint in Microsoft 365 for 5 months. However, thanks to Freeform, it has made my science fair project for the next school year easier. I do not have to use a keyboard like PowerPoint does because I only use PowerPoint on my Chromebook for school, and computers have a keyboard. Well, thanks to Freeform, It does not make me feel tired. It also requires more work to get to PowerPoint. But, because Freeform is an application, it is easier. Also, my iPad is in my arm’s reach because I charge it on the lowest level of my house and it is usable downstairs or upstairs, depending on my overall energy level. I also do not have to login with an account, but I must use my school account to use PowerPoint. Freeform also saves my projects automatically, while PowerPoint requires more work, I also need less material and work. So Freeform has made my life easier to create school presentations. Thank you very much Apple Company for creating this application. You are the best Apple Company!

During first week of use, there's only been small windows of time where Freeform has functioned as it should. 
- Elements of the collaboration repeatedly do not match on both ends. 
- Stuttered results when drawing.
- Elements of collaboration spontaneously reappear after being undone (and will not undo after reappearing).
- App randomly closes/crashes.
- Does not correctly show active collaborators.
- Spontaneous disconnection from the collaboration.
I would not recommend using Freeform for anything practical. You may well also spend more time on the problems, then on what the app is supposed to do.

column9: Not better than Notability in it’s current state
column10:
I love to use apps like this for writing down ideas, creating graphics, and taking notes with visuals. I highly value being able to create lines, arches, snap items to each other (especially perimeters and line up edges of differently shaped objects). I also love a snap-to-grid option. This app has none of those.
	Although there is a grid, I can’t find a way to make objects snap to said grid. What? What’s the point? Who benefits?
	Although, everything else seems about right with this app. It doesn’t have shadows or gradients, but neither does Notability, so I can’t complain. I’m gonna be honest, it’s not worth it for me. I’ll check up maybe another year and see if it’s any better, but I kind of doubt that :/

Trash app 
Coming out from own it own tried 6/7 time but still kicking out of that app

When I first saw this application, I thought it was a really cool idea. I’ve seen apps like this before so it’s not reinventing the wheel, but overall a great addition. when I heard it would be able to update in real time I became skeptical. For the last two years, I’ve been on iOS and have had so many issues with syncing. Like with every single one of their apps, calendar, notes, you name it. At first I thought maybe it’s just me but then I started digging into it and realize this is just an Apple thing so when I heard that they said it would update in real time my first thought was it’s going to have issues with keeping the information up-to-date across different devices. As of right now I have four boards on my computer and two on my iPad and the information looks different on all of them. Lol so until they figure this out, I’m gonna give it three stars for meeting my expectations.

Very cool app & this will be incredible (when it’s fixed ).  This app doesn’t sync correctly across devices & users.  The biggest issue is any hand writing (crayon, pen, etc) is fragmented and not legible from any other users who are trying to see the most current version.  Also, an individual won’t be able to fully see the most recent version if they switch to a different device — parts of the writing are missing.

column9: Great idea but lacking some basic stuff
column10:
I was really excited when Apple announced they were making their own app with an infinite canvas to draw and write on, but trying it today made it feel like this was only half baked… therefore I would like to add what I look forward to seeing in future updates: 

 - The ability to select more than one shape at once !!!! Absolutely crucial I don’t get why the selection tool can’t be used for shapes too.

 - Lines snapping to shapes (the notes app can already do that?) as well as a ruler.

 - (nice to see) lines snapping to the grid and more grid options such as squares or ruled grids

 - Being able to import actual PDF pages to scribble on them like you would with pictures would also be a plus. 

 - night mode? I also fail to understand why the notes app has a proper night mode but Freeform doesn’t it’s not like they haven’t done it before.

 Regardless I think it’s a good start and overall the app is very responsive and pleasant to use until you need to draw a graph or move things around, so I’m looking forward to future updates.

column9: I think they forgot to put in the shape recognition!
column10:
Apple why would you not add shape recognition to this like you have in the notes app. What a missed opportunity… and a bad decision on the part of the PM / UX / Devs to leave this out. 
And no… your predefined shapes are not a substitute for this feature so don’t even try it…

App would be much better with the ability to change page colour, especially dark.

Also, the ability to disable the red underline for grammar in text boxes.

My initial take is that the features are strong and the app has a lot of potential to contend with, and even surpass, other similar existing products. 

However, for platform to ever be adopted as a true collaboration space, it needs to be available to users on older Apple devices as well as other operating systems (Android and Windows especially). 

Incorporating a web UI for Freeform into iCloud.com would be a smart and easy way to do this (like Apple already does with Notes, Files, etc.) so that a level of user authentication would still be in place (through iCloud—everyone would still be in Apple’s sandbox) but the user would not be required to upgrade their hardware to Apple’s latest just to collaborate on a project. 

If Mural can have a web front-end, so can Freeform. Let’s get one ASAP!

column9: Simple, clean and great but not as efficient as I expected it to be
column10: There is a significant lag in pencil strokes after writing in the same board after about 2 days. The performance can definitely be improved. Also, there should be option of disabling auto snapping/smoothening feature of handwriting.

Positives:
- Can write all your thoughts into one canvas without worrying about structure like the notes app
- Can insert links, shapes, images, documents etc.
- real time collaboration by sharing the board over iMessage or facetime call
- convert the entire board to PDF to share across mail if required.

Negatives:
- No dark mode yet.
- lags quite considerably when there’s lot of text or media. This is noticeable when you’re using the apple pencil to jot things down or panning the board to view items across.
- Doesn’t sync automatically in the background. The app needs to brought into foreground for the sync to work.
- No ability to tag or group boards into folders yet.

Tested the app on my iPad Air 2020 and iPhone 13.
It needs performance improvements to be used like a personal research tool. In its current state, you can use it as a whiteboard for meetings and smaller content.

column9: I just have one question: Why?
column10: This app offers so much, yet I have no use for it. Maybe I’m just getting old, but when I collaborate with coworkers, we tend to do it in person using whiteboards and laptops. Something like this is absolute overkill and I plan on sticking with what I know and am comfortable with. I can’t think of a single reason why I would ever need to use Freeform in the future. And frankly, a scary number of people I encounter every day just don’t have the attention span for something like this.
Missing dark mode and basic photo edit tools like flipping the photo horizontally other than that it's very helpful and a great tool to use.

I love this app
Especially the INFINITE canvas!
Annotations / “Pen” Strokes are missing on shared Freeform notes.

All this time beta testing and they still can't launch an app without problems.  I ran into problems with zooming, lagging Apple pencil support, iCloud integration issues.

The zooming issues happen when you zoom in and half the canvas remains un-rendered, instead it's just grey.  Any activity will bring it back, but it doesn't bode well for the future of the app.

Then there is the noticeable lag when using the Apple pencil.  I use an iPad Pro 12.9" 2021 with that has 16Gb to work with, so it ain't slow and it ain't running low on resources.  The pencil stroke lags behind the pencil as though it's working on a 30Hz screen.  I've not seen this as a problem on apps like Concept or Procreate, so what gives Apple.

Then there is the iCloud integration problem, where it keeps asking for the user to be logged in to iCloud even if they are currently logged in.  Again this smacks of Beta quality software, not something we expect from a headline product released after months of testing and development.

As for the UI, it's not like Apple worked hard to do it, so people stop crowing about the slick interface, it's nothing new.

Finally, I wish they'd do something about the app icon, as it looks like it was a contest from a Sunday School group.

column9: Great start, still needs some work
column10:
First off, great job app team. The core functionality is here and I’m excited to have this on any device via iCloud. 

A few requests:
- add pencil hover as a default
- add gesture based drawing (hold on stroke will make a straight line, loosely draw a shape and it populates, etc.)

Those are the big ones for me at the moment. As a UX Designer I’m excited to have another ideation tool available to me.

I don’t understand why Apple decided to just not allow pressure sensitivity. It seems to be a conscious design choice since the technology is there it’s just that Apple decides to forbid you from using pressure sensitivity for some reason.

What this should improve on: it should have folders, a changeable background, more types of pens, splitting into pages instead of one big page.

The functions currently in the application are perfectly and very well usable.

Overall the app is good and Apple take a good move on Microsoft (whiteboard) and Google (jam board).
And need more improvement on the canvas and options and need the flexibility too.

I have used Pages for drawing cartoons and it works really well. However, Freeform takes it to a whole new level. It’s so much easier to insert drawings and shapes, as well as text and sticky notes. However, I have discovered a few limitations. You cannot (to my knowledge) add a color gradient to a shape like you can in pages, as well as add shadows and borders. You can arrange shapes to back/front, but not as much as pages. You can create your desired gradients, shadows, etc. in pages and copy/paste them to Freeform, but that is an extra step. Also, it’s only compatible with iOS and iPadOS 16.2, which is somewhat disappointing for users on older devices.

This is overall a great app, but it’s more of a supplement to pages rather than a replacement.

Freeform falls short in every imaginable metric.

Writing with the Apple Pencil in Freeform feels like writing on some cheap tablet, certainly not an Apple product. The lines lag and they don’t use pressure or tilt either. Apple rightly took pride in eliminating drawing lag with the introduction of their high refresh rate displays and created an unrivaled writing experience by adding tilt and pressure to their pencil, so it’s heartbreaking to see FreeForm released in such a dilapidated state.

Collaboration is is incomparable with non-apple devices and apple devices that aren’t up to date. This means that it’s impossible to rely on FreeForm for whiteboarding since it’s hard to guarantee that everyone is using apple AND has their device up to date.
Even if you assume everyone is apple exclusive and has their software up to date, iCloud is slow to create links and the collaboration feels clumsy. Apple needs to step up their cloud work tremendously if they want to compete with JamBoard.

Once you write in a text box, it’s extremely difficult to get the cursor to the end of the box to add more text.

If these still aren’t issues for you, and you use the app a lot, you’ll quickly discover that you can’t store the boards in folders! Meaning that your boards get cluttered and lost since there’s no way to organize them.

Maybe one day this app will feel like a quality piece of vetted software, but that day is not today

None of the export options are currently working and the ability to convert to PDF same deal. I assume there is an export bug that will be fixed. All other features work great. Promising app. Easy to use.

column9: It’s good…but not enough to be the best
column10:
I take a lot of my notes and do brainstorming on my iPad and was pleased to find that Apple was creating its own app centered around the whiteboard experience. However, while this app may be unique in that it has an infinite canvas, it lacks some essential features that other note apps really succeed with. 

For example, GoodNotes 5 has folders, covers, changeable backgrounds, etc. it also includes GESTURES. Being able to double tap the screen instead of switching tools would be a major quality of life improvement for Freeform. 

Some of the tools features in Freeform are outright redundant. Namely, the shape tool, which for some reason has a wide selection of normal polygons that you have to draw and resize. GoodNotes and quite literally every other notes app I have used incorporated a snap to shape feature as to allow for better creation of shapes. 

Overall, Apple clearly failed in comparison to what other apps provide. I expected more, and the fact that they can’t even reach the bare minimum for a WHITEBOARD APP as a multi-billion dollar company is laughable and egregious. Please rectify literally everything. Don’t support this app, Apple needs to do better before they start getting some downloads.
Unable to delete boards though?

This app is lacking some of the features, like changing color of the canvas, adding tables/swimlanes etc.
But it’s extremely smooth, works across all devices, “sticky notes” integration is wonderful and overall it’s a joy to work with.
Now I can ditch some more subscriptions that I had.
Definitely recommended!

column9: Incredible!  But sorely in need of optimization.
column10:
I love Freeform.  I’ve been looking for a great infinite canvas app, and this one checks all my boxes: intuitive, supports all kinds of embedded content, clean support for text.

But it has some serious performance issues.  I’m on an A12x ipad, and it gets boiling hot while editing my not very big board.  I probably spent an hour handwriting stuff in there and added a half dozen pictures.  Pen strokes now have very jarring latency (not an issue in a fresh board), and panning and zooming are jerky.  Those symptoms combined with the iPad getting hot lead me to believe there’s a bug making some common operation(s) much more computationally intensive than they should be.

This app is super promising.  Thank you to the developers working hard on it.  I know it’s just a beta now and I’m looking forward to the full release!

I kinda like it it just probably needs more features like good notes does. There should also be different pens and a better layout. And also you should add stickers and make it more like a whiteboard
Works the way it should, with few bugs since it was just released. For instance, when trying to delete a board, nothing happens.

column9: Like notes but taken to the next level!
column10: Just got iOS 16.2 and this was installed on my home screen. I was a little confused and then jumped into the Freeform app. It’s like notes but gives you the opportunity to take it to the next level with anything you can think of. It replaces pen and paper. If you need to jot stuff down, reminders, etc. and you can collaborate which is super sick!
This app does the drawing but people so it very good
good app
I love this app, it’s like a giant whiteboard, I don’t know anyone who has iOS 16.2 beta, so I can’t really collaborate with anyone, still love it tho!
I’m caught between several apps right now, and then all of a sudden this appears on my home screen. I love it!
This is what i want. Please make it better and better.
